characters: SHAVED HEADS... FACES PAINTED FOR BATTLE.
AND BEYOND BOONE ARE FORTY ARIKARA WARRIORS CHARGING THRO
LEATHER STRAPS SNAPPING AROUND GLASS' WRISTS AND ANKLES..
JUST THE NIGHT SKY THROUGH THOSE BRANCHES... AND THE SOUN
FROM THE BACK OF THE HORSE...
MASS OF WHITE WORMS... MAGGOTS... COVERING THE DEEP GASHE
ON A RATTLESNAKE COILED INCHES FROM HIS FACE
SNAPS GLASS' LEG BACK IN PLACE.
A SMALL CLUMP OF DRIED GRASS...
THE TREES... FEATHERS RISING FROM THE MOHAWKS SPLITTING T
A FLURRY OF IMAGES ACCOMPANIED BY THE MEDICINE MAN'S V.O.
ON THE BUFFALO AND DANCING FIGURE DESIGNS
OUT OF THE GRAVE... TIGHT AND CLAUSTROPHOBIC
BRIDGER AND PIG HOLDING THE SCREAMING GLASS DOWN AS HENRY
ANSWER ME OR I BLOW YOUR DAMN HEAD
THE BADLY WOUNDED TRAPPER... NOW DEAD...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON A SINGLE COTTONWOOD LEAF... brown and crisp... clinging to its empty branch... the solitary sign of life an otherwise barren tree.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A gust of wind... the leaf breaks free... flutters down, landing in the slow current of the Missouri. The last lea of the fall, taking its final journey south.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As it floats along the surface, rising and falling with t current, all we can hear is the river's gentle movement.. the trickle of water... the splash of timid rapids... unt DISTANT VOICES invade this world... soft at first, but growing louder... LAUGHTER... SINGING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then our leaf CRASHES INTO A WOODEN BOARD... the BOW BOAT. We hear the VOICES EVEN CLEARER... MEN'S VOICES, as rise up the bow... see it's a FLATBOAT BEACHED ON A SANDB at the center of the river.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beyond the flatboat are the voices... TWENTY MEN of the R Mountain Fur Company, making camp along the shore... haul wood, building campfires, pitching squares of canvas for makeshift rooftops. And this camp is full of life because these are some of the first men to ever see this untouche wilderness... men with a whole new world just waiting for them to claim their share.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAPTAIN ANDREW HENRY, (late 20's), dressed in a buckskin jacket with long fringe... thick belt pulled tightly arou his waist with two pistols and a knife hanging from it. H stands out among the others... like an imposter pretendin be a member of some exclusive club. He pulls off one of h gloves... examines the BLOOD-FILLED BLISTERS lining his p

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From across the camp, JOHN FITZGERALD, (40's), solid and thick... dark eyes of a killer, watches Henry. He nudges MACE BOONE, (40's), a thief in a previous life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Likely got a splinter. Can't figure what to do without Mama here to pull it out for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boone chuckles... spits in Henry's direction. 2.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Need a doc, Captain?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry looks up... sees Fitzgerald and Boone grinning at h He slides his glove back on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gather more wood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fitzgerald waits for Henry to turn, then gives his back a exaggerated salute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (under his breath) Shame my Pap was a broken down drunk. Else he could've bought me a Captain's job too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boone snickers. Fitzgerald stomps his boot onto a branch, easily snaps it into two easy-to-carry pieces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got a plan for these fires, Captain, or are we roastin' berries all the way up to Fort Union?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass and the others will be back with some game, Fitzgerald. Just make sure you have the fires ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My supper's in the hands of a hermit nigger, a kid and a dummy. Hell, my belly feels full already.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fitzgerald's boot CRACKS another branch... and when it do we hear the EXPLOSION OF A GUNSHOT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And a CLOUD OF SMOKE surrounding the LONG BARREL OF AN ANSTADT RIFLE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The smoke fades, and at the other end of the rifle we see face of HUGH GLASS, (40's), African-American, one eye sti closed, as the other calmly stares down that barrel.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Shit fire, you got him, Mr. Glass! 3.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass lowers the rifle, as PIG GILMORE, (30's), fat and filthy, races past.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Square as a barn door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JIM BRIDGER, (17), young eyes that have already seen a lo nods to Glass as he follows Pig.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass watches Pig and Bridger trot through the trees to a fallen ELK. Glass walks calmly after them, graceful in th world... his rifle so comfortable in his hand it's like h was born with it there. Pig crouches over the dead elk... grins up at Glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right where you said he'd be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But bigger than we figured. Gonna be a load to haul back to camp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have to split it up I reckon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yep. Bridger'll take the tail, and Pig you haul the rest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Fitzgerald was right about Pig being a little slow, because he just nods... pulls out his knife to cut the ta off for Bridger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bridger and Glass exchange a smile... until Glass notices something... steps over the elk, his eyes locked on the ground beside it. He runs a finger over the dirt... touch a broken twig.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another one close by?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass doesn't answer... studies the track... feels the ne brush... inhales the scent from his hand. Bridger and Pig watch him... exchange a confused glance. And then in a fl of movement, Glass is on his feet, racing away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hugh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass just keeps running. Pig and Bridger chase after him

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men building fires... laughing... enjoying themselves Boone on the outskirts, gathering branches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...dodging trees... leaping over fallen logs... loading h Anstadt as he runs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...but not as gracefully. Pig trips... slams to the ground... scrambles back to his feet to continue on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...seeing other men playing cards. He stops along the edg of camp, drops the wood to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No rule says I'm the only one that's gotta gather this shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The other men don't even notice. Then an ARROW WHIZZES THROUGH THE AIR from behind Boone... THWACK... it hits hi the back of the neck... erupts out the front of his throa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boone stands frozen... confused... reaches up and grabs t bloody arrow... finally drops to his knees. And that's wh a TRAPPER looks up... sees Boone on his knees, holding th arrow, his mouth open like a dying fish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHOOSH... AN ARROW SAILS INTO THE TRAPPER'S CHEST, sendin him flying backward. The camp explodes into chaos... men YELLING... grabbing for weapons... stumbling over each ot as they duck behind trees. 5.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...taking aim at the attacking figures.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Arikara pour into camp, arrows flying... knives and hatchets swinging. And this is a massacre... the Arikara wading through the trappers... stabbing... clubbing... scalping. This once peaceful world is filled with a sicke mix of war cries and screams of death.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fitzgerald rises up from behind a log... aims his rifle.. BOOM... takes down one of the warriors. He starts reloadi as ANOTHER WARRIOR charges him... draws back his knife. Fitzgerald pours the powder, but knows he isn't going to it in time... the warrior leaps toward him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...BOOM... it's like the warrior hits an invisible wall.. flies back to the ground, very dead. Fitzgerald spins... sees Glass and his Anstadt right behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fitzgerald takes off... flips his rifle around, swings it like a club across a warrior's head... WHACK!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry shoves a TRAPPER toward the water. An arrow drives into the trapper's leg... he goes down. Henry lifts the m to pull him into the river, but several more arrows bury the man's back... he falls limp. Henry FIRES HIS PISTOLS, dropping the WARRIOR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bridger and Pig join Glass... splash into the river, SHOO back at the attacking Arikara. The water deepens, and the start swimming toward the flatboat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ARROWS HISS into the water all around them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass is still in the shallows... aims his pistol... BAM. shoots an oncoming warrior... spins after the other men.. joins them as they near the flatboat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A final TRAPPER charges down the shore behind them. SEVER WARRIORS pursue him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He aims his pistol over his shoulder as he runs... pulls trigger... CLICK... pulls it again... CLICK. But he's too scared to stop his finger... CLICK... CLICK... CLICK... THUD... as a hatchet buries in his back. He crashes face first into the shallows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Arikara leader, (ELK'S TONGUE), animal bones braided his mohawk, a NECKLACE OF HUMAN EARS around his neck, straddles the dying man. Elk's Tongue grabs the Trapper b the hair, and CUTS OFF HIS LEFT EAR, then holds it up to Glass and the others, as he SCREAMS HIS WAR CRY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass and the men shove the flatboat off the sandbar... s scrambling aboard, as arrows dart past them... drive into wooden boat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly a WARRIOR EXPLODES FROM THE WATER... tackles Bri as he climbs up the side of the flatboat... jerks him bac into the river. Bridger flails in the water... watches th warrior raise his hatchet high to slam down... just as Gl SLAMS THE BUTT OF HIS ANSTADT into the back of the Warrio head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Warrior collapses under the surface. Glass grabs Bridger's hand... drags him up onto the deck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Glass is already gone... FIRING BACK AT THE ARIKARA, the current carries them away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pig looks over the side... sees a frantic WILLIAM ANDERSO gripped to the edge. Pig pulls him onto the boat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fitzgerald and Glass grab LONGPOLES... shove them against river's bottom to pick up speed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry stands on deck, watching as Elk's Tongue yanks a DY TRAPPER's head back by his hair to peel away his scalp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry drops his eyes... can't watch. The TRAPPER'S SCREAM ECHOES OVER HIM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quiet and dark... the battle long over. The flatboat floa with the gentle current. The NINE SURVIVING TRAPPERS are scattered around the deck... 7. Glass digging an arrow out of WALLACE MURPHY'S SHOULDER.. Fitzgerald poling on one side with Anderson on the other. STUBBY BILL VANCE and Pig standing patrol with their rifles... Bridger doctoring a badly WOUNDED TRAPPER... an Henry standing at the front of the flatboat, staring off blankly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the plan, Captain?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry's still lost in those screams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain! What the hell do we do now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry snaps out of his stare... turns to the men... obvio doesn't have an answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're just floatin' farther from Fort Union.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry's eyes instinctively look to Glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Missouri's no good. Not if the `Ree's running it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So we just float the hell down to Mexico or wherever else this river takes us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We get ourselves safe outta range, then track another course up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Add weeks to the trip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Better that than endin' up scalped on the side of the river.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shoving him away) Shut up, kid, you don't get no say in this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bridger starts to respond, but Fitzgerald's angry glare s him. 8.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (back to Henry) And in case you hadn't noticed, Captain, we're twelve men short of what we were. (off the badly wounded

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thirteen before long.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand our situation, Mr. Fitzgerald. We do like Glass said... put some distance between us and the Arikara, then chart a course to Fort Union.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fitzgerald MUMBLES UNDER HIS BREATH... rolls those dark e to Anderson. Glass gives Henry a nod.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...as hands push the body over the side of the boat. It splashes into the water... floats downstream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We PULL BACK... see that the flatboat is beached along th bank of the river. Glass and Pig watch the body drift awa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reckon it's better `an lettin' the `Ree find him... take his ears... slice what's left all to shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass nods... steps down off the boat to Henry and the others. They're gathered around a map spread out on the ground. Henry runs his finger along a THIN BLUE LINE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So we hike west to the Grand, then follow it up to Fort Union.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On foot? You got any idea how long that's gonna take? It'll be winter before we get there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unless we come across a post... trade for some horses. 9.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No posts that far out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So if we do this, we do every step with our own feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We make camp here for the night, then load supplies and head out for the Grand at first light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And gather extra blankets `cause there won't be any fires.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More GRUMBLING from Fitzgerald and Anderson, as they move toward the cover of trees. Bridger walks up beside Glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you... for what you done back there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'd have done the same for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bridger nods... he hopes so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pig on watch... sitting at the base of a tree, rifle acro his lap, eyes wide, scanning the darkness. All clear. He peers back to camp... Fitzgerald, Anderson, Stubby Bill, Murphy wrapped in blankets... passing a bottle of whiskey around. Bridger across from Fitzgerald, poking at the dir with a stick. Henry is off to one side, still studying th map. Glass sits against a tree, cleaning his Anstadt rifl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fitzgerald watches Glass a beat, then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You treat that Anstadt sweeter than any woman, Glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never seen a woman that could stop a `Ree from three hundred feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew a particular big-breasted redhead in Boston that might come close. 10.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The others manage a small laugh. Glass just keeps working that rifle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bring it over here for me to have a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass doesn't look up... wipes a rag down the barrel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you hear what I said, boy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still nothing from Glass. And Fitzgerald doesn't like that... the tension's growing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You seen it before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fitzgerald turns that mean, drunken glare on Bridger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'd you say, kid?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bridger hesitates a beat... until the other men's eyes fo a response.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said you shoulda already got a look when he saved you with it earlier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The camp falls still... nobody talks to Fitzgerald like that... especially when he's drunk. There isn't a sound except for Glass working methodically on his rifle...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...until the SWISH OF BLADE OVER LEATHER, as Fitzgerald t the blade from his belt... flings it into the dirt betwee Bridger's legs... AN INCH BELOW HIS CROTCH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fitzgerald stares at Bridger, daring him to react. But Bridger's too scared... doesn't, so Fitzgerald just smile

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're lucky you ain't a man yet. (off the blade) Else that mighta nicked somethin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A few NERVOUS CHUCKLES from the others, hoping this is ov And it is, because Fitzgerald reaches over and pulls the knife away... cleans the dirty blade on Bridger's leg. 11.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And unlike you, I don't need savin' by him or nobody else. Remember that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fitzgerald stands... wobbles just a bit. He slides the kn back into his belt, then steadies his drunken gaze on Gla

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The others exchange nervous glances... uh-oh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fitzgerald walks to Glass... snaps his fingers for Glass' Anstadt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lemme see what's so special `bout that shooter of yours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing from Glass, so Fitzgerald grabs the barrel, but G holds firm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Middle of workin' on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well you can stop workin' on it, and let me have a look like I said.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fitzgerald gives another tug, but Glass' grip only grows tighter. His eyes roll up to Fitzgerald... make it clear isn't giving up his rifle. And they hold that stare just hard as they're holding Glass' rifle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You forget your place?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Best I can tell, my place is right where I want it... on the smart end of my rifle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fitzgerald realizes the barrel he's holding is aimed righ his stomach, while Glass' hand seems suddenly very close the trigger. But Fitzgerald's pride and that whiskey won' let him lose this tug of war.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd be careful if I was you, boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And this thing's about to turn real ugly... until...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's enough, Fitzgerald. Go sober up and get to sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you're passed out when we break camp tomorrow, I leave you here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fitzgerald holds his glare on Glass, then releases the ri shoving it back at Glass. He glances to Henry, and throws back a big gulp from the bottle just for spite, before backing away from Glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the trouble with this part of the world. No mirrors. Niggers forget what color they are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass ignores Fitzgerald... goes back to his rifle. Fitzgerald tosses the bottle at Anderson, then jerks his blanket up... walks off to sleep by himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass glances up from his work... just long enough to giv Bridger a nod.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fitzgerald sleeping off that whiskey. The others snoring a cluster at the center of the camp. Henry lies there awake... looks across to Glass, still sitting against the tree, a HANDRAWN MAP in his lap, as his eyes pierce the darkness. Henry eases over to Glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't sleep either?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never like closin' my eyes when I'm not sure who'll be standin' over me when I open `em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I keep thinking about Boone and the others... how maybe I should've had us make camp further up river.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tracks I saw... those `Ree had been tailin' us for a while. They'd have gone as far north as it took.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a good man, Captain. Soon as you realize that, these others will too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry likes hearing that... still isn't sure it's true. 13.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your years trappin' and guidin' out here... have you had much experience with the Arikara?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enough to try and stay outta their way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (motions to Glass' map) But you know this country well enough to get us past them... up to Fort Union?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I been here a long while. Whether that gets us to Union or not...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry waits for more... doesn't get it. So he just nods a starts back to his blanket.... stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What Fitzgerald said earlier... he doesn't speak for the rest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wasn't wrong. Truth is that's what I prefer about this country... it's got no eye for the color of a man's skin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try to get some sleep, Hugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry climbs back under his blanket. Glass just sits ther looking at the map.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...primitive at best. Sketched mountains... winding blue lines for rivers... small dots are scattered about with n beside them... "Brazeau", "Talbot", "Union". And DOZENS O TRIANGLE PINE TREES have been drawn, representing the end wilderness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We TIGHTEN ON THOSE TRIANGLES until we're lost in them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thick with trees. Henry leads the men single file through the woods. They each have a canvas sack of supplies over shoulder, and their rifle in their hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The only sound is their feet crunching the dried leaves, even that seems too loud as their eyes dart about, search for any sign of attack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shouldn't we have hit the Grand by now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll reach it soon enough. Glass said to keep this course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass said. Too bad I don't see him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's on account he's up ahead makin' sure it's clear, and you get to keep your ears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fitzgerald throws Pig an angry glance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or he's run off and left us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wouldn't do that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fitzgerald GRUNTS... doesn't believe that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My bet, that nigger's used to runnin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass moves slowly through the brush, almost gliding... subtle twists and turns to avoid branches and leaves... careful not to leave his scent behind. And his eyes cut through the trees as he moves... digging for any sign of movement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He spots something at his feet... crouches down, running finger over the SMALL ANIMAL TRACK in the dirt. 15.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O.S. RUSTLING snaps his head up... to the TREMBLING OF BUSHES... growing harder... whatever's in there is coming toward Glass. He calmly raises his rifle... presses the stock firmly against his shoulder... closes one eye as he takes steady aim down the long barrel...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...to the shapes rumbling out of the brush... TWO BEAR CU playfully wrestling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass lowers the Anstadt... looks past the cubs for somet else... but the woods are empty. A SUDDEN FEAR FILLS GLAS EYES...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...he spins... right into the GIANT GRIZZLY SWINGING ITS AT HIM... hitting him across the side of the neck. The animal's razor claws tear into Glass' throat, as the forc sends him flying through the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass sails into a thick tree... the CRACK OF HIS LEG SNAPPING against the trunk. The rifle falls from his hand The Grizzly lets out a massive ROAR... charges Glass. Gla crawls to the Anstadt... grabs it... has just enough time tilt the rifle toward the bear... BOOM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry takes off at full sprint. The other men follow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...tosses Glass aside with a powerful swing. Glass hits t ground with a PAINFUL THUD. He starts CRAWLING AWAY, pull the KNIFE from his belt as the bear rises up like a giant behind him... swings... tears its claws across Glass's ba shredding deep into his flesh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass is fighting for his life now... flailing with the knife... slicing it across the bear's paw as it whips pas him. The wound slows the bear enough for Glass to start crawling again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the Grizzly doesn't give Glass the chance... ROARS... on him in a flash, a BLUR OF CLAWS AND FANGS... tearing across Glass' head... ripping into his face... his chest. 16.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass drives his knife into the bear again... deep... try to tear through the layers of flesh to something more vit

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...locked in a death grip... tumbling along the ground... trading violent blows... Glass' blade versus the Grizzly' claws and fangs... snapping small trees as they roll over them... toward the edge of a steep embankment...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... and ROLL DOWN... spinning over and over... each ROARI AT THE OTHER... Glass pounding the knife into the bear ag and again as they fall... neither willing to surrender as they careen down the slope at a dizzying pace, then SLAM THE BOTTOM WITH A CRUNCH. And the forest falls still... Glass hidden somewhere beneath the massive animal... both deathly motionless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bridger's the first to reach the battleground... sees the FRIGHTENED BEAR CUBS SCURRY AWAY. He follows the bloody ground and crushed underbrush to the top of the slope... looks down to the mass of flesh at the bottom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christ Almighty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry, Pig, and the others reach the edge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No answer. And all they can see is the bear, so they scan the trees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still nothing. So Bridger takes off down the slope... los his balance but rolling back to his feet. He reaches the bear... sees GLASS' MANGLED ARM STICKING OUT FROM BENEATH 17.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's down here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bridger uses all his strength to push the bear off, as th other men scramble down. But Bridger can't budge the mass carcass... not until Stubby Bill and Pig join in... shove animal over, revealing the bloody mass that is Hugh Glass

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...his throat is torn wide open... scalp peeled back from just above his eyebrows, hanging off the skull... stomach chest a gruesome design of gashes and cuts. His right leg is snapped, the jagged bone jutting out through the skin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bridger's legs give out... he drops to a knee and vomits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Jesus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's tore to pieces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men stare down at Glass' corpse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Least he took that Grizz down with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wished he'da done it without firing his rifle. If there wasn't no `Ree around before, there will be now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that's all Pig can stand... he TACKLES FITZGERALD... roll to the ground. And in a flash Fitzgerald is on top, raining punches down on Pig... turning his face into a bl mess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry and Anderson grab Fitzgerald... drag him off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then somehow, GLASS GASPS... this horrible, GUTTURAL MOAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy Christ, he's alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry and Bridger fall to their knees beside Glass. Glass looks up at the men, tries to focus through the blood and pain. His breathing is just a GURGLING WHEEZE... bubbles forming along the deep gashes in his throat with each gas 18.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get me some water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stubby Bill tosses Henry his canteen. Henry empties it ov Glass' throat... his face and scalp. The water hits the wounds and immediately transforms to blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Jesus... Jesus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass lifts a trembling hand to his throat... feels the gaping wound. His eyes widen in horror. He COUGHS... the air splashes blood up from the open wounds in his throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay, Hugh. (pushing Glass' hand away) You're going to be fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry spins his head away from Glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need some rags before he bleeds out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pig whips a shirt from his bag... shreds it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And your whiskey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pig tosses a bottle to Henry. Henry pours it over the gashes. The BURNING PAIN arches Glass... he CRIES OUT in that same horrific moan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold him down, Bridger, goddammit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bridger throws his weight against Glass' shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rest of you spread out... scout a circle around us. Fitzgerald, you and Anderson take west and north. Murphy and Mike south and east. Watch for anyone that might've heard that shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And for the first time, Henry seems like a leader of men. firm... in complete control... just as Glass said he woul be. So the men hurry off to their positions. 19.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about me, Cap?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get down here and help me tie off these wounds best we can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pig shakily joins Henry in wrapping the wounds. The blood keeps seeping out, soaking the rags.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It won't stop bleedin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up, Pig.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're fixing you up, Hugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass is like a shredded rag doll... dazed eyes staring u them as they work on his wounds... wrapping the rags arou his throat... laying his scalp back over his skull, and t another rag around it and under his jaw to hold it in pla

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bridger wipes the blood from Glass' face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's gonna be fine, Mr. Glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry glances down to the PUDDLE OF BLOOD spilling out ov his knees... oozing out from beneath Glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roll him over... easy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They gently push Glass onto one side, revealing DEEP, JAG GASHES running across the width of Glass' back. Henry sta at the open flesh, ready to panic again... but he doesn't Instead he looks to Pig.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get me the kit. We need to stitch his back up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about the rest of him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's losing more blood back here. (off the throat) And I don't know what to do with that yet. 20.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pig digs out a thick needle and spool of black thread... hands it to Henry. Henry grabs the whiskey bottle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry for how this is about to burn, Hugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry pours the whiskey over Glass' back. And the pain mu be excruciating, because Glass lets out a HORRIBLE WAIL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fitzgerald and Anderson standing watch together in the tr Glass' scream erupts through the trees, and they both immediately crouch down to a knee... out of sight to anyo out there that might have heard that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're torturin' the poor bastard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And riskin' gettin' us killed in the process. Proper thing would be to end it for him quick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: `Less he could pull through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You seen what that grizz did to him. Shit, Glass'll be dead inside a hour. We all will be if he keeps screamin' like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HENRY, BRIDGER AND PIG WORKING OVER GLASS... Bridger and pressing Glass' scalp down, as Henry slides the needle an thread through the skin, suturing the wound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FITZGERALD PEERING BACK THROUGH THE TREES... to Henry doctoring Glass. Fitzgerald shakes his head in anger... turns back to the darkening forest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass rests unconscious on the ground. Two branches act a splint on his leg. A blanket covers his body... his face like a swollen, disfigured, Frankenstein's monster... stitches of black thread holding it in place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry crouches a short distance away from him, rinsing hi hands under a canteen. Bridger and Pig stand beside him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We wait. Does he have any kin you know of?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He keeps to hisself. Never mentioned none.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go get the others. Tell `em we're making camp here for the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pig starts hustling away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And gather some wood, but make sure it's dry. We don't want much smoke when we cook that grizzly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...lying dead on the ground, its claws and fangs soaked w blood... Glass' blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what's left of the grizzly... its fur cut away... sla of flesh butchered from its skeleton.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A fire burns at the center of camp... a chunk of meat roa above the flame. The men sit around the fire... 22. Murphy reaches up... tears a strip of meat from the roast tossing it in his mouth. The men are silent... the pall o Glass' attack still hanging over them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bridger rises... walks to the Grizzly... crouches down ov it, grabbing the animal's enormous paw. It dwarfs his own hand, as he examines the claws. Bridger pulls out his knife... stretches the claw out to its full length, and C IT OFF AT ITS BASE.

dialogues.speaker: FITZGERALD, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: What makes you think you earned a claw?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bridger turns with a start... sees Fitzgerald standing ov him, meat in his hand... his lips shiny with the grease.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't take that grizz down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It ain't for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bridger stands... walks over to the sleeping Glass. Pig's already crouched beside him. Bridger lifts Glass' small leather POSSIBLES BAG from beside the Anstadt rifle... dr the claw inside... throws a look back to Fitzgerald.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pig holds his palm out just above Glass' mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can feel some air outta his mouth. Maybe Captain sealed up his throat proper, huh? (off Bridger's silence) Whatta you figure his odds are, Jim?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bridger stares down at what's left of Glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Long.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun peeks over the horizon, sending an orange glow ac the treetops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...unconscious but alive... his raspy breaths are weak an staggered. The SHADOWS OF MEN hover over him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...because Henry and the others surround Glass, staring d at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What that bear did to him... I didn't expect he'd last this long.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I seen a fella go a week once after a lion jumped him. Fever finally finished him off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatta we do, Cap?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long beat, then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We give him his chance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry turns and walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fire has burned down to nothing. The men sleep scatte about. Murphy stands just outside of camp, rifle ready, keeping watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass lies there awake... eyes wide open... a living corp And his breathing is just as labored as before... raspy, blood-soaked strains.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fitzgerald tosses and turns, listening to Glass' gurgling

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ain't doin' him or us no favors, Captain, lettin' him suffer that way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry's awake, but doesn't answer. He's holding his pisto in his hand, as he stares at Glass... thinking the same t Fitzgerald just said. But he doesn't move... not yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fitzgerald angrily wraps a blanket around his head, muffl the sound. Bridger sits beyond him... smiles at Fitzgeral misery, as he attaches the BEAR CLAW TO A THIN LEATHER STRAP... a necklace. 24.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bridger kneels over a SHIVERING GLASS, holding wet rags o his head. Pig and Henry stand over them, watching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fitzgerald, Anderson, Murphy and Stubby Bill sit huddled across camp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fever's hit. Won't be long now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I seen a bad one drag on days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...eyes open... he can hear every word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FITZGERALD (O.S.) (cont'd) Insides shut down... flesh starts to spoil and turn. Ain't no way for...

dialogues.speaker: HENRY, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Quiet, Fitzgerald.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...points a stick at Glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We keep sittin' here watchin' him die, only gives the `Ree more chance to find us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry doesn't answer... just keeps staring down at Glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's burnin', Cap. Water turns to boil as soon as it touches him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry considers this, then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pig, take Anderson and scout ahead. Grand should be just west of here. Find us the best route.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tryin' to buy Glass time don't make sense for the rest of us, Captain. 25.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get movin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pig nods... grabs his gear. He and Anderson take off out camp. Henry turns... walks over to Fitzgerald and Stubby Bill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You two can start digging a grave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fitzgerald tosses the stick away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Least it's a step in the right direction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fitzgerald is covered in dirt and sweat, standing knee de in Glass' grave. Stubby Bill stands over him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any coyote digs that deep deserves the meal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes Stubby Bill's hand... pulls himself out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass won't know the difference no ways.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pig and Anderson walk back into camp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Found it, Cap. Right where Glass had us headed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No more than a mile or so out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry looks to Bridger, still doctoring Glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We could build a litter. Haul him with us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's rocky and steep goin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry looks to Pig for an honest answer. 26.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marshy and thick on the other side. We could try it, but...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pig shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I signed on as a trapper, not a goddamn mule.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shape he's in... I don't see no way he'd make bein' drug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry nods, his mind racing for a solution. And before lo his hand is back on that pistol. He pulls it from his bel

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The other men all drop their heads... except for Fitzgerald... he's ready to see this end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry stares down at Glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lay that rag over his eyes, Mr. Bridger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, Captain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bridger hesitates, then reaches to fold the wet rag down Glass' wide open eyes. And Glass must know what's happeni because his eyes roll up to Bridger's... his lips try to a word... his hand digs its fingers into the dirt beside

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...the boy looking away as he pulls the rag over our eyes everything goes black.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Step clear, Mr. Bridger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A LONG BEAT in the dark, waiting for that gunshot, then..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry standing over Glass... pistol aimed down. His hand trembles slightly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pig turns away... presses his hands over his ears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bridger takes a few steps back... stares at Henry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry struggles to steady his aim, until finally it calms because he's thought of something else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a seventy dollar bonus from the Rocky Mountain Fur Company to the two men that stay with Glass... see this through. Then give him a proper burial.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll stay with him... money or not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Same here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't let you stay back, Pig. Without Glass, I'll need you to scout.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry looks to the others... they all drop their eyes... interested.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just need one more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two won't stand much chance against a party of `Ree, Captain, and seventy dollars won't buy me a new setta ears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hundred then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still nothing from the others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They can have my share too. I owe Glass that at least.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That case I'll hang back with the kid. I don't mind fallin' a day or so behind for two hundred. 28.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Glass is to be cared for until. Understood?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (motions to Bridger) I'll let the young doctor do his job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry hesitates... doesn't like this, but knows it's the option left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rest gather your gear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bridger reaches down... lifts the rag from Glass' face. Their eyes meet... Bridger gives Glass a nod.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry and the others are loaded and ready to leave. Pig bends down over Glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll see ya at Fort Union, Hugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass's glazed eyes focus on Pig. He moves the only thing can... BLINKS a "yes" back at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Fitzgerald and

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As long as necessary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll look after him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry turns... leads the men into the trees... toward the Grand... toward Fort Union.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's left of a small fire is nothing but smoldering ash Bridger crouches beside Glass, pouring a thin stream of b between his lips. Fitzgerald reaches in... grabs Glass' Anstadt leaning against the tree.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll take first watch. 29.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not with his rifle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trust me, kid, he ain't gonna be needin' it tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fitzgerald disappears into the trees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pig stands on a ridge, scouting a course. He waves back t Henry and the others. They start toward him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass conscious on the ground... that same labored breath

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...smiling down at Glass as he grabs the Anstadt, holds i runs his hand down the barrel, as comfortable as if it we his own.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were right to protect this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then he disappears... and we're left alone, staring up at branches above us... the evening sky... accompanied by Gl deathly breaths.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bridger kneels beside the stream, filling canteens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fitzgerald sits bored against a tree, twisting a knife in hands... flipping it point first into the dirt... grabbin repeating... twist... flip... thwack. And as he does, his eyes are locked on Glass. 30.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally, Fitzgerald snaps the knife from the dirt, stands and walks over to Glass. Glass is asleep. Fitzgerald crouches down over him... eyes his red, infected wounds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When are you gonna die, boy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fitzgerald reaches out with the blade... gently touches o of the threads holding Glass' throat together. And when h does, GLASS' EYES FLY OPEN... focus on Fitzgerald.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fitzgerald doesn't even flinch... just holds that knife t there against Glass' throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm nearly a week behind Henry's bunch on accounta havin' to tend to you. Be easier on us all if you'd take that last breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two men hold a stare... until Fitzgerald pulls back t knife... grabs a bloodstained rag from beside them... bal it up in his fist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could help ya with that if you'd like. Muzzle ya right now... end all this sufferin' quick and easy. Nobody'd ever know you give up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fitzgerald moves the rag over Glass' nose and mouth... ho it there, just inches above.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just gimme a blink if you want me to do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass locks his eyes on Fitzgerald's... both men unblinki

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A DROP OF BLOOD hangs from the rag... finally falls... la on Glass' lips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fitzgerald almost smiles, waiting for the inevitable... a Glass stares back, fighting the urge to blink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly Bridger's hand clamps down on Fitzgerald's shoul Fitzgerald spins... startled.

dialogues.speaker: BRIDGER, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: What's goin' on? 31.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fitzgerald jumps with a start, sees it's Bridger, and is pissed that Bridger scared him... and interrupted his business. He rises quickly, planting his meaty hand in Bridger's chest, and SLAMMING HIM BACK AGAINST A TREE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you ever question me, you little piss-ant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bridger tries to fight back, but Fitzgerald's too strong. holds him pressed against the tree... slams a heavy elbow into Bridger's mouth, splitting his lip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd just as soon leave both you and your nigger here to rot. `Cept killin' you ain't worth givin' up your share.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But that don't mean I can't be coaxed into changin' my mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fitzgerald shoves him away... Bridger stumbles and falls. Fitzgerald tosses the bloody rag at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I was just doin' your job... cleanin' him up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fitzgerald grabs Glass' Anstadt, almost daring Bridger to something. Of course Bridger doesn't. Fitzgerald walks toward the trees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't ya pour some more broth down his throat... keep him alive another week so we can fall farther back. End up walkin' all the way to Fort Union on our own. `Ree would love to poach on just two. (turns to Bridger) I promise ya, you'll look a helluva lot worse than Glass when they're done with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bridger watches him disappear into the trees... wipes the blood from his lip with a trembling hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From high above the trees. The world is silent... peacefu until SEVERAL STARTLED CROWS shoot up from the treetops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...the sound of FRENZIED BREATHING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bridger! Get your ass up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dim light fills the frame... then FITZGERALD'S FACE right front of us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: `Ree.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep quiet. I was down at the creek... there's twenty of `em at least, comin' this way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, shit. Whatta we do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We run. Now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Fitzgerald's just whispering, but it's with such powe that Bridger has no response... watches as Fitzgerald gat his bag, starts throwing in food and supplies. Bridger is scared out of his mind... does the same... grabs for his rifle, resting near Glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bridger freezes... in his panic, he'd forgotten all about Glass. And now the wounded man's eyes stare up at him... understanding perfectly what's happening around him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about Glass? 33.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's on his own, same as us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't leave him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then I'm talkin' to a dead man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass gives Bridger the slightest of nods... go. But Bridger's frozen... doesn't know what to do... until Fitzgerald shoves him back to life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass reaches out a weak hand out for his Anstadt... claw for his weapon. Bridger starts to hand it to Glass, but Fitzgerald grabs it first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you doin'? He needs that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He couldn't hold it if you tarred it to his hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass strains to hold out his trembling hand for his gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's his goddamn rifle! That's all he's got!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And more than he'll need.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fitzgerald scoops up Glass' knife as well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't leave him with nothin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Fitzgerald is already sprinting away... disappearing the trees. Glass stares after him, his once-calm eyes suddenly filled with a rage. And Bridger's frozen again, lost between duty and fear... until finally, he just shak his head and takes off into the trees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass's empty hand falls back to the ground... he tries t yell out in anger, but his throat EXPLODES IN PAIN. His h digs into the dirt... pulls him over onto his side. He fl over to his stomach... GASPS IN PAIN... 34. then using his one good arm, drags himself over the dirt, healthy leg pushing weakly at the ground, trying to prope him forward... a futile chase after Fitzgerald and Bridge

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...inch by inch... farther than he's been in days. But it still only a few yards, and now he lies in the open... a clear target for the Arikara.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then he spots that hole... the grave Fitzgerald dug for h He grunts into action... grabs SEVERAL, THIN BROKEN BRANC from the ground, then claws forward, each movement excruciating... until finally, he reaches the hole, and R INTO IT... lands with a PAINFUL CRUNCH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He rests there a moment, trying to regain any ounce of strength. Finally he fights through the pain... shoves th branches back up... spreading them across the hole as camouflage... a thin veil, but all that Glass has.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He lies there defenseless... INSIDE HIS OWN GRAVE. Hiding listening for the Arikara's arrival... waiting to die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cold and grey. Fitzgerald crouches beside a small fire, warming his hands. WHISPS OF SMOKE rise into the sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We ran the better part of six hours. Had to gain some ground on Henry and them others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bridger sits at the base of a tree, not listening... staring... his mind replaying the desertion of Glass over over. He notices the smoke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Best douse that smoke before them `Ree spot it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We put enough distance between us and them. And it's too damn cold to go without one. 35.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All we know, they hoofed it through the night same as us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shakes his head) A dozen `Ree can't make the time us two did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bridger looks back to the trees... then considers somethi stares at Fitzgerald a beat, before...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was twenty earlier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When you woke me... you said you'd spotted twenty `Ree.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dozen... twenty. I wasn't in a mood to count feathers. Hell, one `Ree woulda been too many.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fitzgerald empties his canteen over the fire, killing the flames. Bridger stares at the water pouring out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was you even doin' down at the creak in the middle of the night?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd already brought plenty a water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fitzgerald doesn't answer. Bridger tightens his grip on h rifle... slowly rises.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Answer me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't start questionin' me on accounta you feelin' guilty `bout leavin' your nigger buddy behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bridger musters up all the courage he can... aims his rif at Fitzgerald.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fitzgerald stares back at Bridger and his rifle... eyes taking in everything... a snake sizing up its prey. Then Fitzgerald stands... takes a step toward the boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you askin'? Why it was you turned your back on Glass? Why you let him die to save your own sorry skin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: `Cause you was scared shitless, that's why.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The `Ree... did you see `em? (off Fitzgerald's silence)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not a one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bridger CRIES OUT... starts to pull the trigger, when Fitzgerald's hand flashes out, grabbing the barrel, and shoving the butt back into Bridger's face... THWACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The force of the blow knocks Bridger back to the ground, Fitzgerald holds his grip on the rifle barrel... flips it around to aim it at the boy. Blood drips down Bridger's h as he stares up at his rifle pointed down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fitzgerald's finger tightens on the trigger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So that there is the answer to your question.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Fitzgerald PULLS THE TRIGGER... AND BRIDGER SQUEEZES EYES SHUT IN FEAR... THEN CLICK. Bridger opens his eyes.. sees Fitzgerald sneering down at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the next time you aim to kill somebody, kid, best remember your gun won't fire without a flint.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fitzgerald tosses the rifle back at Bridger, and turns aw Bridger's face flushes with rage and humiliation... he charges Fitzgerald from behind... tackles him to the ground... starts pounding Fitzgerald with punches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A few of them land, but it's only a moment before Fitzger is back in control... HEAD-BUTTING Bridger off of him... 37. tossing him away, then KICKING BRIDGER IN THE STOMACH... AGAIN. He grabs his knife... is ready to finish Bridger off...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...but Fitzgerald is smart enough to know that out here, are safer than one... even when one is just a kid. He sta walking away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm goin' back for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Far as we ran all night, you couldn't find Glass with dogs and a map. And I don't believe you really want to. `Cause after leavin' him to die the first time, I doubt he'd be too happy to see you now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fitzgerald digs at the dirt with the knife... covers the fire's remains.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And just so we're clear. If you try to backtrack without me knowin', or ever get so guilty you feel the need to tell somebody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fitzgerald looks at Bridger... hard... evil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll have no choice but to gut you from nuts to nose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fitzgerald stares his point home, then shoves the blade i his belt, and stands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bridger wipes the blood from his face, then throws one la glance behind him before following Fitzgerald.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Empty and quiet... no sign of life... until GLASS' HAND R BETWEEN THE BRANCHES. His fingers dig into the earth, pulling himself up from the hole... a dead man climbing o of his own grave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He rolls out to the ground... arches in pain when his bac hits the cold, hard surface. 38. Glass lies there shivering, regaining what little strengt has, then rolls over... starts dragging himself again wit that one good arm. He makes it to the blanket... wraps it around him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass rests there in the center of camp... unable to move his eyes scanning the surroundings... no food... no water and he's wide open in this clearing... an easy target for predator. So he grabs his Possibles bag and GUNPOWDER HOR and drags himself toward the cover of brush.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And every movement takes all the will Glass has... a push with his good leg followed by a pull with his healthy arm inch by inch... foot by foot... sweat pouring down his fa as he finally reaches the cover of the trees... continues on... dragging himself across the forest floor in a desperate, hopeless crawl for survival.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But finally it's too much for Glass... the fever and pain overwhelm him. He collapses... falls unconscious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass lies in the dirt, weak... dehydrated... starving. H looks at his hands... scratched and bloody from clawing h weight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He unwraps his small, leather Possibles bag... dumps it t the ground, revealing it contents... flints, a straight razor, his map, and a LEATHER NECKLACE WITH THE SIX-INCH CLAW attached. Glass grabs the razor... cuts SEVERAL THIN STRIPS FROM THE BLANKET, and wraps them around his hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He shoves the rest back in the bag, and does the only thi he can do... start crawling again... push with his health leg... pull with his good arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass dragging himself up a steep slope... over rocks... jagged edges catching the wounds... tearing the primitive stitching. The gashes rip wider... blood oozes down, leav a crimson trail dripping down the rock behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wind is howling through the trees. Glass lies beneath cluster of brush... shivering... bleeding. Every aching breath creates a puff of smoke in the cold, night air. 39.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thick with a sea of four-foot high Cattails... like minia cornstalks. Looking down from above the marsh we see a tw foot wide path of crushed plants that reaches the center the marsh, and stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We tighten on the end of the path, until we see Glass lyi among the Cattails. He's sawing off one of the stalks wit the straight razor... peeling away the husk, and eating t tender flesh beneath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mosquitoes move in clouds around him... over his face... arms. But Glass' injured body only allows him one action a time, so the mosquitoes have their fill of him, as he g on the Cattail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass pulling himself along the ground... stopping to tea FEW BERRIES from a plant, and shove them in his mouth. He flinches as he swallows. He starts to move again, but freezes... listens... RUSHING WATER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass digs his fingers into the ground with new energy... pulls himself toward the sound... up over a ridge... and there it is at the bottom of the ridge...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...THE GRAND RIVER... WATER. Glass crawls down toward it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass drags himself to the river's edge, cupping handfuls water and rubbing it over his parched lips... withstandin the pain to gulp it down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he does, Glass notices a FISH hovering in the shallows beside him. He makes a desperate grab for the fish, but i darts easily away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass cups more water to his mouth, but with each drink, feels the water leak from a hole in his throat... run dow his neck. He leans out over the surface to check his reflection... barely recognizes the swollen, stitched- together, disfigured face staring back at him. He fights the urge to vomit... pulls the razor from the leather bag and cuts more strips of blanket, soaking them in the rive then cleaning his wounds. 40.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He runs a finger up to his shredded throat... around the open, wet hole. He cups another handful of water to his mouth... strains to swallow, then feels the liquid GURGLE OF THE HOLE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass shoves the cloth against the wound... tries to pres the flesh together... no good. He dumps out his Possibles bag... stares at the meager contents. He picks up one of flints... looks to the powderhorn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...as Glass SPARKS one of the flints... ignites the grass As the fire grows, Glass pours a handful of GUNPOWDER fro the horn, and RUBS IT ALL OVER THE HOLE IN HIS THROAT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He lifts several small blades of burning grass... a minia torch. And only then do we realize what he's about to do. because he stares at the flame a beat, then raises it tow his gunpowder-covered throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The flame nears the black powder, and LEAPS OFF THE GRASS igniting the powder, and SETTING GLASS'S NECK ON FIRE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass falls back to the ground in agony... TRIES TO SCREA but his burning, shredded vocal chords won't allow him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gunpowder sizzles and burns... the flame spreads... Glass' flesh sears... melts. And the pain is too much for Glass... he passes out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON GLASS... looking dead beside the river, but we k he's alive because we can hear those same painful, raspy breaths.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then we hear something else... an O.S. RATTLING, grow LOUDER... FASTER... BUZZING... until Glass' eyes flash op

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass stares back in horror... has time to throw up his a in protection as the snake STRIKES... SINKS ITS FANGS INT HIS FOREARM. 41. He shakes it free, but can't escape the snake's next strike... locking its jaws onto Glass' burned throat. Gla opens his mouth to scream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Glass' eyes flying open in the glaring sun, as he awa from his nightmare... looks to his arm... no snake. His h instinctively jumps to his melted throat. No bites.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But that's when he hears it... we all do... that same RATTLING FROM HIS DREAM. Glass slowly turns his head towa the sound...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and there's a RATTLESNAKE COILED just a few feet away. Only it isn't poised to attack Glass. It's facing the oth way, its target a FIELD MOUSE, trapped against a rock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The snake attacks, sinking its fangs into the mouse. The field mouse tumbles over... quivers as the poison runs through its body, then dies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Glass watches the snake begin to make a meal of the mo his hand grips a rock. He drags himself toward the occupi snake... raises the rock high, then SMASHES IT DOWN ON TH SNAKE'S HEAD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass immediately pulls the razor from his bag, and slice off the rattlesnake's head, the field mouse still lodged halfway inside. Glass then drags the razor down the lengt of the snake... digs his fingers under the fresh seam, th peels the outer layer down off the rattler.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With the skin still hanging off the round tube of flesh, Glass BITES INTO THE SNAKE, tearing off a chunk of meat. gobbles it down, slowing only to painfully swallow the fo past his injured throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...the head, skin, and not much else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GLASS - at the water's edge, drinking... touching his charred, melted throat... no leaks. He opens his Possible bag... pulls out the GRIZZLY CLAW NECKLACE... stares at i beat, then slips it over his head. 42.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He drags out the map... spreads it on the ground, then th a glance around him... fingers the point on the blue line a rough guess of his location.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Fort Union at the top... hundreds of miles north. Fort Brazeau south... but not nearly as far away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass gazes north up the Grand, as if he can see Fitzgera and Bridger just ahead of him. Then he looks back down to his reflection in the water... battered and scarred. He looks to his leg... all but worthless for now... his one arm. It's clear he's not ready to take revenge on anyone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So Glass shoves the map back into the bag... ties it arou his arm with the powderhorn and blanket, then grabs a THI FALLEN LOG, and rolls it into the river. Glass crawls in behind it... deeper, until the current grows strong enoug carry the weight of his mangled body downstream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass drapes his healthy arm over the log, and starts floating... letting the river do the work. He watches the land move past him faster than it has in days... and with all the agony of every move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Winding through the open prairie. Glass hangs onto the log... floats with the gentle current.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sinking sun casts an orange glow over the water. Glas floats downstream... past a HERD OF ELK grazing along the riverbank. The animals don't even notice him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dark... the moon hidden behind clouds. A heavy mist hangs over the river. Glass is draped across the log, eyes closed... letting the slow current carry him south. But t his eyes open... because he hears something... a LOW RUMB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass looks to the river banks... too foggy to see anythi clearly. The RUMBLE GROWS LOUDER. He peers ahead... too dark to see much... just ANOTHER SPLINTERED LOG floating front of him, its one jagged branch rising up in the air. 43.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But then THE LOG VANISHES. Glass squints through the fog, scanning the surface. But it's gone... the water's empty. that LOW RUMBLE GROWS EVEN LOUDER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass looks to the water beside him... a BRANCH GLIDES PA AT A HIGHER SPEED. And now Glass knows what's coming, but it's too late... because the world suddenly turns upside down, as Glass tumbles over the edge of a TWENTY FOOT WATERFALL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He spirals downward... crashes into the rushing current. He's washed forward with the suddenly violent rapids. The pull him under the surface, then toss him GASPING back ou

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The river carries him blindly through the mist... tossing turning... SLAMMING HIM INTO A HUGE BOULDER... CRACK... h spins off, swept away headfirst... the foaming water suck him down the rocky gauntlet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tumbles over more boulders... his Possibles bag snaps loose... Glass makes a grab for it, but is suddenly flipp down another set of falls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Possibles Bag is lost in the raging river.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass sinks beneath the surface, then floats back up, as rapids calm... spit Glass to the gentle shallows. His bod drifts face-down toward shore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And just when we're sure Glass has to finally be dead, hi arm reaches up from the water... he digs his fingers into muddy bank, and drags himself out of the river.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass collapses unconscious to the ground, his body shrou in that mist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIGHT ON THE LEFT SIDE OF GLASS' FACE... the right still pressed into the muddy bank. The sun beats down... then SHADOWS APPEAR... BOUNCE ACROSS HIM... something is stand over Glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then a VULTURE'S HEAD DROPS INTO FRAME...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...latches its beak onto Glass' cheek... tugs at it... stretches it. Glass' eyes pop open... we PULL BACK to see THREE VULTURES surrounding Glass' body, pecking and clawi at his battered wounds. 44.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass swings his good arm, knocking one of the vultures a He tries to cry out, but only that PRIMITIVE HISS ERUPTS his throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The vultures dance away from his flailing... aren't willi to give up their meal so easily... dart in for quick atta on his flesh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass grasps a branch... swings at the birds, beating the back. The vultures give up the battle... fly away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass crumbles back to the ground... squints up into the sun... the SILHOUETTES OF THE VULTURES CIRCLING ABOVE HIM waiting for him to die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass looks down to his wounds, again oozing blood. He glances around... sees a ridge just a few hundred yards a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the base of the ridge, a GIANT BOULDER has broken free creating a partial cave. Glass starts crawling toward it. And if it's possible, he looks even closer to death now t when he started this journey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No more than ten feet deep, but enough to hide from predators. Glass drags himself as far back in the recess he can... collapses against the rock wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass gathers loose sticks and grass into a small pile... begins sparking rocks together to build a fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fire burns beside Glass, as he TEARS A SINGLE THREAD cloth from the tattered blanket, then feeds it through a hole in a JAGGED, NEEDLE-SIZED SLIVER OF SHARPENED ROCK.. man-made needle and thread.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass goes to work on the open wounds of his chest... piercing his skin with the rock... wincing with pain as h tugs the thread through the fresh hole in his skin... pie the other side of the wound, then pulls the flesh tightly together... before repeating the excruciating process all over again... pierce... pull... pierce... tighten. 45.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The moon's glow reflects off the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...holding a small sharp stone, and SCRATCHING LETTERS IN THE CAVE'S ROCK WALL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WE PAN DOWN TO THE GROUND... still listening to the SCRATCHING OF THE ROCK as we glide across the dirt... rea the fire... its flame warm and strong. We TIGHTEN ON THE FIRE, until WE'RE INSIDE IT... and then WE PULL BACK...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and we see the fire has long died away... just black a The O.S. SCRATCHING has silenced. We glide back across th cave floor... to Glass unconscious on the ground. And abo him on the wall, we see what he had been scratching...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Robbed and left to die by Fitzgerald and Bridger. If fin eether kill for Hugh Glass"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hold on those words a beat, then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DROPS OF RAIN dot the surface. THUNDER RUMBLES... the rai grows heavier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rain pouring... gullies of water run down the ridge, spew over the mouth of the cave. But inside, Glass doesn't stir... lying there just as we last saw him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rain coming down in buckets. The river's raging.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clouds drift across the moon... the storm has ended. 46.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sunny and clear. A rabbit hops along... stops for a momen outside the cave. Beyond it, Glass is still sprawled on t cave floor... he must be dead. The rabbit continues on pa
