dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIGHT ON GLASS' FACE... as his eyes flutter open. He star straight ahead, unmoving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass crawls out of the crevice... shields his eyes from sun, as he takes in the scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The river has sunk back to normal, leaving the banks batt and muddy. The water is thick and brown with all the floo earth it pulled up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass uses all his strength to rise up to his knees, then higher... onto his healthy leg. He braces himself against tree. He's still crooked and hunched over, but for the fi time since the Grizzly attack, he looks more like a man t an animal. He bends down... picks up a BROKEN TREE BRANCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass limps along the bank... beside the brown water stir up from the flood. He moves along the washed-out area, searching for food... grabs some plants... tears them fro the ground to chew on the roots.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He continues on... spots a DEAD SNAPPING TURTLE drowned i the flood, frozen on its back. Glass kneels down to pick the turtle... sniffs it. As he does, he spots something across the river... a DEER, staring back at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass slowly raises his IMAGINARY RIFLE... takes careful at the deer... pulls the trigger. If only he had his Anst

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But then the deer's head snaps... to something beyond Gla Glass follows the animal's eyes... turns to the ridge... the FIVE ARIKARA WARRIORS STANDING AT GLASS' CAVE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass drops flat to the ground behind a tree uprooted in flood. He looks back across the river... THE DEER IS LONG GONE. 47.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass inches his head up over the tree... to the warriors crouched outside the cave... studying the tracks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass' eyes jump to the soft dirt along the river... HIS FOOTPRINTS CLEAR... an obvious trail leading right to him He throws a glance around... nowhere to run even if he co So he starts backing into the river on his stomach... fee first... dragging a small branch over the tracks around h wiping them away as he moves. And his eyes are locked on Arikara... watching to see if they spot him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But they haven't yet, and Glass keeps sliding backward... five feet off shore... only three feet deep in the murky water and sludge. But if he goes any further, the current will catch him... pull him into the next set of violent rapids... and make him a clear target.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Arikara follow the tracks down from the cave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass sinks neck-deep into the water... the Arikara keep coming... near the river. So Glass drops beneath the surf

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Glass' eyes spread wide... searching the muddy water. grabs a LARGE ROCK... rolls onto his back, and places the rock on his stomach, its weight holding him firmly to the river bottom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON THE ARIKARA WARRIORS... following Glass' tracks the edge of the river... looking out over the brown river

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass pressing his head back against the bottom... starin through the cloudy water... to the FIVE SHADOWS STANDING A FEW FEET AWAY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Arikara... unknowingly standing just above Glass... looking back to the tracks... scanning the water. But the surface is empty, and the river's too thick with mud to s anything below. 48.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But they keep looking... and we're waiting for Glass to explode from the river, gasping for air. But he doesn't.. and they keep scanning for what seems an eternity, until finally, the warriors turn... start walking back up the p

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind them, Glass' face inches to the surface... pulls i some oxygen... watches as they fade into the trees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then Glass rolls the rock away... starts moving deeper in the river... fighting the current to grab rocks and boulders... pulling himself to the other side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass limps through the trees, still dripping with the mu water of the Grand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass is on his knees, desperately grabbing for a TINY FI MOUSE. The rodent escapes into a hole. Glass claws at the ground after it. He's starving to death.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rain beating down through the trees. Glass huddles in cluster of bushes, trying to stay dry... shivering in the cold. He reaches out from the cover, grabbing his moccasi boot standing in the rain. He pulls it in... slurps back rainfall that it's caught.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass limps slowly across the rolling prairie. He's weak. starving... isn't going to make it much further. He drops his hands and knees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then he feels something... the ground almost tremblin under his hands. He watches his hands quiver with vibrati A RUMBLE BUILDS. Glass strains to hear... looks to the cr of a hill... labors up the gentle slope toward the sound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass reaches the crest... looks over the other side to a HERD OF BUFFALO THUNDERING ACROSS THE PRAIRIE. 49.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An incredible site... hundreds of massive creatures... th hooves tearing up the earth, leaving a cloud of dust behi them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind the herd, a PACK OF WOLVES FIGHT OVER A FALLEN BUFFALO.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass lies in the high grass, watching the wolves SNARL A SNAP over the remains. And he eyes that buffalo... the closest he's been to food in days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The five wolves rest around the downed buffalo, their sno bloody from the meal. Suddenly, one of the wolves' heads snaps up... bares its teeth... SNARLS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then we see what the wolf is growling at... Glass... limping out of the shadows toward the animals, holding a BURNING SAGE BUSH IN EACH HAND... like giant FLAMING HAND clawing in the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wolves jump to their feet, unsure of what's approachi They growl at Glass. But Glass keeps coming... doing his best to YELL... more like GROWL back at the wolves. He swings the flaming brush, tossing glowing sparks through air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wolves spread out, instinctively surrounding Glass. B Glass singles out each one... charges, waving the flames. driving each wolf back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four of the wolves back away, but the leader holds its ground... even moves toward Glass... only a few feet away SNARLING... bloody jaws ready to attack, but still not su what its up against.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass shakes the flames at the wolf... it SNAPS AT GLASS' ARM. Glass swings the other... slams the fiery plant acro the wolf's head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wolf YELPS... leaps back... starts to run away, but t back... makes another charge at Glass. But Glass is ready throws the flaming ball of sage at the wolf, then clubs i with the other. The animal's fur begins to burn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The frightened wolf has had enough... rolls on the ground then spins to join the rest of its pack. They run a safe distance, then stop... keeping a watch on Glass. 50.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass drags the burning sage bushes along the ground, igniting the grass and brush... creating a foot-high flam wall between him and the wolves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stretches the flame into a circle, a fiery ring surrou the fallen buffalo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wolves have seen enough... turn... race away from the flames.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the grass around him burns, Glass drops the sage plant attacks the buffalo remains, tearing away bloody chunks o flesh from the carcass, and shoving them into his mouth.. starving animal that's finally found food.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From high above the prairie... Glass and the buffalo at t center of that glowing ring of fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wind's gusting... bending the high golden grass over its side. Glass moves slowly across, pulling his collar u to shield his face from the cold winds. He spots somethin in the distant sky ahead... a THIN LINE OF BLACK SMOKE. Glass picks up his pace... hope spurring him on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The charred, skeletal remains of a tribe's village... jus black posts where tee-pees once stood... a half-burned lo lodge still smokes, sending that black line into the sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass limps through the graveyard of structures... all si of life in this village long gone. He searches a basket.. pulls out a BLANKET... wraps it around his shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass steps into the smoky warmth of the lodge... black a empty. He slides down to the floor... unwraps strips of roasted buffalo from what's left of his blanket. He start take a bite, when SOMETHING DARTS PAST THE DOORWAY TO THE BACK ROOM. The O.S. SHUFFLING OF FEET.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass freezes... he isn't alone. He rises... grabs a splintered post like a spear... eases toward the doorway. raises the post to swing... 51.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and sees the SMALL PUPPY standing in the back room. Th dog takes off around a crumbled wall. Glass follows it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass limps across the room... turns the corner of the crumbled wall... and sees the dog slide to a stop beside ANCIENT ARIKARA SQUAW, huddled in the corner, her bony ar outstretched in front of her in weak defense. And her eye are SOLID WHITE... the old woman is blind. She CRIES OUT CHANT over and over... her death chant, as she waits for stranger to kill her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass stands frozen... confused. He tries to speak, but h throat still won't let him. He crouches down in front of old woman... reaches for her hand, but she flails him awa He grabs her again... gently... just holds it until she calms... studying the woman... her hollow face all skin a bones... she's obviously dying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulls the strip of buffalo meat from his pocket... pus it into the squaw's hand. She immediately jerks it to her mouth... and that's when Glass sees the WOMAN HAS NO TEET she can't eat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass turns to an old pot tipped over on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass carries the pot toward a nearby stream. The dog scurries out behind him... follows Glass to the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pot boils over burning logs. Glass dips a cup in, pulling out a warm broth. He carries it to the squaw, sti sitting in the corner... takes her hand, placing the cup it for her. She gulps the liquid back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass goes back to refill the cup. The old woman MUMBLES SOMETHING we can't understand... over and over, as Glass brings the cup back to her. He tries to ease it into her hand, but the woman pushes it away... slides her hand up Glass' arm to his face... patting it... MUMBLING THOSE SA WORDS... thanking Glass. 52.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass carries several blankets toward the lodge. The pupp trails behind him, biting at one of the corners... hangin as Glass pulls him across the dirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass enters the back room with the blankets... stops whe sees the old woman slumped over to the floor, her white e frozen open in a lifeless stare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass has stacked several burned posts into a crude pyre the edge of the village. The squaw lies atop the pyre, covered in the blankets he gathered for her. Glass stands beside the pyre, a FLAMING TORCH in his hand. The puppy rests at his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THREE INDIANS sit on horseback, watching Glass light the pyre... the flames rise into the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass crouches... pets the dog, as he watches the flames spread... engulf the woman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...floating into the night. Beyond the sparks, we see something else... THOSE THREE INDIANS GALLOPING TOWARD TH VILLAGE... FAST.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now Glass sees them too... knows it's too late to run he just stands there. But the dog's seen enough... darts away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass watches the Indians ride into the village... their braided hair and dress is different than the Arikara we'v seen earlier, because these are SIOUX WARRIORS, and Glass knows it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sioux surround Glass on horseback... stare down at Gl The lead warrior (SPOTTED HORSE), (30's), poised and stro points to the flaming pyre... says something to Glass. 53.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass tries to answer... can't... touches his scarred thr Spotted Horse slides gracefully off his horse. The other warriors, (THREE FEATHERS and RUNNING FOX) do the same... close in on Glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass stands firm. Spotted Horse says something else to h Again, Glass touches his throat... holds his jacket out f his sides... no weapons. Spotted Horse studies Glass hard reaches out, wiping his finger down Glass' cheek, almost testing to see if the color comes off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of the other warriors pats Glass' hair... smiles... s something to the others. Spotted Horse and the other warr join him, each touching Glass' hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then Spotted Horse spots Glass' necklace... the grizzly c hanging from it. He examines the enormous claw, then nods Glass' stitching and scars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Griz-lee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass hears the familiar word... nods. Three Feathers pul a WHITE SPECK from the back of Glass' neck... holds it up Spotted Horse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spotted Horse jerks out his knife. Glass is confused... holds up his hand, as he takes a step back. But Three Feathers and Running Fox grab Glass... secure him... pull jacket down off his shoulders, exposing his shirt, as Spo Horse walks around behind Glass... raises the knife... Gl GROWLS A PLEA... but Spotted Horse slices the knife down Glass' back... just cutting open his shirt... and reveali

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The three warriors exchange glances... they've obviously never seen anything like this. Glass sees their reaction. throws a nervous glance... what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three Feathers runs his hand across Glass' back, dragging HANDFUL OF WORMS for Glass to see. As Glass' eyes widen i panic, Spotted Horse SLAMS THE BUTT OF HIS KNIFE against Glass' head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass drops to his knees... makes a dazed grab for Spotte Horse... misses... and Spotted Horse HITS GLASS AGAIN. Gl tumbles unconscious to the dirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spotted Horse says something to the others... they grab Glass' limp arms... drag him toward the horses. 54.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dozens of glowing campfires dot the prairie, along with a of tee-pees, their willow poles fanning against the night sky. Animal hides and painted designs decorate the variou tee-pees and lodges. SIOUX CHILDREN laugh and play about village... freeze when they hear Spotted Horse and the ot riders splash across the stream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The warriors ride into the village, Glass' body tossed ov the back of Three Feather's horse. The children race to t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON GLASS... regaining consciousness... eyes blinkin trying to focus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...to the children's eager faces swarming around him... studying this strange face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spotted Horse - YELLING SOMETHING at the children... they back away from Glass... fall into line behind the riders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sioux MEN and WOMEN watch as the procession moves past... a tee-pee set away from the rest... its hide walls decora with wild lightning bolts and buffalo and vaguely human figures circling the sun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An OLD MEDICINE MAN, gnarled and leathery, a DEAD RAVEN t in his long hair, his naked chest painted with red and bl stripes, steps out of the tee-pee. He eyes Glass, as Thre Feathers and Running Fox carry him inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, the Medicine Man begins CHANTING.

dialogues.speaker: LEATHER STRAPS SNAPPING AROUND GLASS' WRISTS AND ANKLES..
dialogues.text: stretched tight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass, naked, on his stomach at the center of the tee-pee his arms and legs outstretched, secured to wooden stakes the ground. The white worms cover his back. 55.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Medicine Man... CHANTING... waving burning sticks in air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A THICK LIQUID BOILING IN A POT... the Medicine Man's twi hand reaching a gourd container in... filling it with the steaming mixture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The liquid POURING OVER GLASS' BACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GLASS' FACE... arched to the sky... twisted in horrible p He SCREAMS THAT HORRIBLE GROWLING CRY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MORE IMAGES... even faster... the CHANTING more frantic..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SIOUX WOMAN,(WAKI), staring down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HANDS wiping a GREEN SLUDGE over Glass' neck... chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Medicine Man dancing... chanting... shaking sticks li with RATTLESNAKE TAILS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The moonlight shining through the tee-pee, illuminating t images of the buffalo and dancing shapes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Waki gently pouring fluid into Glass' mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Medicine Man holding the SEVERED HEAD OF A SNAKE... lightly sinking the fangs around the wounds on Glass' thr

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GLASS' EYES... wide open... rolling up white into his hea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AND THE CHANTING STOPS... the world goes dark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cutting through the open prairie. Snow-covered peaks touc the sky in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fitzgerald and Bridger trudge their way across the prairi dressed in furs. They rise up a steep slope... reach the top, and spot the cluster of log buildings inside a massi thirty-foot tall wooden fence. Fort Union.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bridger smiles... relieved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: `Bout goddamn time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They start down the slope. Fitzgerald grabs Bridger's arm firmly. 56.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we're understood on everything... Glass' dyin' in his sleep... us buryin' him like was agreed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bridger doesn't respond. Fitzgerald doesn't like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're as guilty as me in leavin' him. Don't you forget that. You got a future up here. No sense tossin' it away when he was as good as dead already. Shit, all we did was skip the funeral.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bridger pulls his arm free... continues on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't take to givin' up that two- hundred on accounta you gettin' weak-kneed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bridger keeps walking. Fitzgerald follows behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like a small town surrounded by a log wall. The main TRAD POST BUILDING is busy... TRAPPERS, SIOUX, all with things trade. But most of the life is in the FORT UNION SALOON n door... crowded with customers downstairs, and just as bu in the whores' rooms upstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small village of tents rests off to the side of the buildings, holding the overflow of traffic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fitzgerald and Bridger enter the crowded room... squeeze their way to the bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twice the folks here than when we left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We should go see Captain Henry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Far as we hiked... we got time for a drink on the company's tab. 57.

dialogues.speaker: PIG, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Jim!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They spin... see Pig, Murphy and Stubby Bill sitting at a table. Pig scrambles up... rushes to Bridger, locking him a big bear hug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You made it! I was scared the `Ree mighta caught up to ya.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If your fat ass could get through, we didn't have no worries.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pig glares at Fitzgerald... watches him walk to the table joining the others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (off Fitzgerald, to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Had to be a helluva long walk for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bridger nods... Pig has no idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hugh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bridger hesitates a beat, then just shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guess we all knowed how it would turn out. Did he suffer much more?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another long beat, then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A PROSTITUTE walks down the stairs... stops on the landin waiting for her next customer. Fitzgerald spots her... grins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe we best go see Henry, kid. I just got a itch to spend the first of my two-hundred.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The other men laugh. Not Bridger. 58.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry sits at his desk. Fitzgerald and Bridger stand acro from him. The others... Pig, Anderson, Murphy, and Stubby Bill crowd the room behind them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't pretend to been his friend, but I respect any man that fights the way he done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the grave?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We had those extra days so we went deeper... covered it in rocks. To keep the scavengers off him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any sign of hostiles?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not a one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The words are like a punch in the gut to Bridger. He can' take the pain... opens his mouth to speak, but Fitzgerald beats him to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Truth is, I was worried `bout `Ree, and ready to get movin', but Bridger here argued to stay and make a cross for the grave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bridger's head snaps to Fitzgerald... don't make this wor

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So that's what we did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pig reaches up... gives Bridger a pat on the back. But to Bridger, it feels like a red-hot blade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glad to hear you pulled your weight, Mr. Bridger. I knew you would.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More than his share, Captain. 59.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now Fitzgerald has snared Bridger into his lie. Bridg drops his eyes to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Speaking of shares.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry turns to a SAFE resting against the wall. Fitzgeral watches as Henry spins the dial... locks in the combinati then pulls the latch. The safe door swings open...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...revealing STACKS OF CASH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fitzgerald's eyes lock on all that money. Henry pulls out handful... starts counting them out onto the desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Am I to assume the agreed arrangement didn't change?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fortunate for me, it did not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well thank you both for your courage and honor. You have done yourselves proud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fitzgerald swipes up his pile of bills. Henry drops a cou bills in front of Bridger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're owed something for what you did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bridger stares down at the bills a beat, then snatches them... pushes his way out of the office before he might to look someone in the eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's beat hisself up most of the trip... wishin' he'da done more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We all saw the shape Glass was in. There was no more to be done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what I been tellin' him. 60.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Empty, except for Bridger curled up on his cot, squeezing those crumpled bills in his hand, crying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass sleeps under a buffalo robe. His eyes flicker open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GLASS - His hand reaching up to his throat. It looks much better than we last saw. And the stitches are gone from h face, now just long, pink scars. He stiffly raises himsel up... remembers his back... struggles to reach behind him scarred but clean... no maggots.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks beside him... sees BUCKSKIN PANTS AND SHIRT rest on the ground... waiting for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON GLASS... dressed... pushing his way out through flap of the tee-pee... limping out into the midday sun, a shielding his eyes. He looks like a man that hasn't seen light of day for weeks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass adjusts to the brightness... stares in wonder at th scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then we see what Glass is looking at, and understand reaction... the entire village is blanketed in snow. The Sioux VILLAGERS move about, wearing heavy skins and furs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A WOMEN'S O.S. VOICE turns Glass...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...to WAKI, the woman from the images, walking toward him bundled in fur. She says something else we can't understand... points to Glass' feet. Glass looks down... his BARE FEET BURIED DEEP IN THE SNOW. He hadn't noticed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then Waki smiles... a sweet, pretty smile. She takes hand... leads him back into the tee-pee. 61.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass and Waki enter. She pulls a pair of moccasins from basket... hands them to Glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He slips them on, then presses his fingers against his throat... almost trying to hold it all inside to make it work, then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (scratching and rough) Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Waki doesn't understand... just raises a cup of liquid... says something, then touches his throat... motions for hi drink. Glass sips the drink... grimaces... shakes his hea trying to give the cup back, but Waki refuses... points a his throat, and motions for him to drink. Glass stares in the cup a beat, then gulps it back... shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bad medicine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Waki smiles... hands him his BEAR CLAW NECKLACE. Glass no in thanks, then achingly lifts his arms up to slip it ove his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long have I been here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Waki just stares back... no idea what Glass said.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're Sioux. I only know a bit a Pawnee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass stumbles through a sentence of Pawnee. Waki shakes head... throws a jumble of Sioux back at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The snow... my healin'. (points to himself) Me. (points to the ground) Here. How long?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Waki shakes her head again. Glass leads her outside. 62.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass points to the sun overhead, then raises both hands, fingers outstretched.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How many suns? Ten?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Waki studies Glass... the sun... begins to understand. Sh nods... SAYS A WORD... holds up all ten of her fingers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ten suns?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then Waki closes her hands into fists... opens them again closes them again... SAYS A DIFFERENT WORD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christ.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass glances around... for the first time, notices Sioux and WOMEN staring at him. Children freeze in the middle o their play... all eyes locked on Glass. TWO SMALL BOYS, ( MOON and LITTLE ONE), repeat the same TWO WORDS to each other...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tatanka Wicasa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...over and over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass stares back, unsure. Then...

dialogues.speaker: SPOTTED HORSE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Buff-A-lo Man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass turns... sees Yellow Horse stepping out of a tee-pe

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spotted Horse (cont'd) (very broken english) What they call you. (points to Glass' hair) Fur of Buff-A-lo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass touches his hair... nods... smiles. The children sm and laugh now too... repeat the words LOUDER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You speak English.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Need words when trade with whites. 63.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well I'm grateful for you bringing me here... havin' them care for me. (off Spotted Horse's nod) Now if you could point me which way it is you do your tradin'... with the whites.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whites. Bra-zo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fort Brazeau? That's where I'm tryin' to get. Is it far from here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spotted Horse doesn't understand. Glass motions into the distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Far? Long way?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spotted Horse points to a horse, then holds up three fing

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three days on horse?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spotted Horse nods... looks Glass over, and shakes his he

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not walk. Hides soon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass doesn't understand... until Spotted Horse points to ROW OF BUFFALO HIDES hanging from a line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spotted Horse (cont'd) We trade Bra-zo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass stares at the tanning hides, then down at his leg. Finally, he nods. Spotted Horse starts walking... waves f Glass to follow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spotted Horse (cont'd) Come. Eat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass follows after him. The children sneak in behind, giggling as they tail Glass across camp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass glances back... New Moon and Little One duck behind tee-pee... wait for him to continue before they scoot bac out after him. 64.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass, Spotted Horse, Three Feathers, Running Fox and OTH WARRIORS sit around a fire, eating with CHIEF RED HAWK, t Medicine Man, and several other TRIBAL ELDERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men stole my rifle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sioux don't understand. Glass reaches over, taking Spotted Horse's plate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They took. They took...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass aims an imaginary rifle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...my rifle. My gear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now Spotted Horse understands... translates for the other

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They left me to die. So I mean to find `em both. Get my rifle back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spotted Horse translates again. Red Hawk nods, studying Glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Red Hawk SAYS SOMETHING to Glass... motions to the BEAR C NECKLACE. Glass looks to Spotted Horse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Red Hawk ask who kill griz-lee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass touches his chest. Red Hawk nods, impressed. Glass points to the JAGGED SCARS running up Red Hawk's neck to MISSING RIGHT EAR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grizzly?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Red Hawk smiles... shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arikara.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That word, Glass understands. Red Hawk rambles a long sentence in Sioux. The other members LAUGH. 65.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He say Arikara take right ear of Sioux. Left ear of whites. Not know what they take from you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass smiles along with the others. They continue their m

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snow falls over Glass, as he stands outside the tee-pee, flexing his injured leg... putting more weight on it... testing its recovered strength.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, a SPEAR PLANTS INTO THE GROUND BETWEEN HIS FEET Glass turns, startled... sees Spotted Horse, Three Feathe Running Fox, and several OTHER WARRIORS staring at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass' eyes jump from the spear to the warriors, unsure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spotted Horse strides to Glass... grabs the spear, then s it sideways... stares at Glass, until a smile spreads acr Spotted Horse's face... he holds the spear out to Glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buff-A-lo Man hunt with Sioux?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass relaxes... nods... takes the spear from Spotted Hor Three Feathers hands a BUFFALO HIDE to Glass... motions f Glass to put it on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tatanka Wicasa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass wraps the hide around him. The Warriors smile and n

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A world of silent white... like we're inside a giant snow globe. The sky is emptying all the snow it has over us... pouring down... the only sound comes from the flakes hitt the already fallen snow. The pale trunks of Cottonwoods r up from the white ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then out of the white... a SHAPE APPEARS... a GIANT WOLF WALKING ON ITS HIND LEGS. But as the wolf comes closer, w see it's not a wolf at all... it's THREE FEATHERS, wearin his WOLF SKIN. He CRIES OUT... HOWLING WILDLY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A few yards beside him, another WARRIOR is doing the same CHANTING... beating his spear against the Cottonwoods as walks. 66.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...walking slowly through the trees, carrying the spear. Yellow Bear is beside him... motions for Glass to spread

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...we see the fur-covered warriors are formed into a wide circle... and slowly converging... YELLING... pounding th spears... making as much noise as possible, as they tight their ring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...watching DISTANT CHANTING WARRIORS pushing through the trees. V.O. SNORTING... our POV darts sideways... charges through the brush... slides to a stop when we see Running moving toward us... spins back another direction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...the falling snow clinging to his face... covering the buffalo hide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then a MASSIVE SHAPE BLASTS through the trees ahead o him. Glass freezes, his grip tightening on the spear. He looks to Spotted Horse, who nods... YELLS OUT, beating hi spear against the trees, and motioning for Glass to do th same.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass is apprehensive at first... just lightly tapping hi spear. But as the other warriors' chants grow, Glass gets caught up in the hunt... begins beating the trees... YELL as loud as his throat will allow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...to Spotted Horse waving his spear... back over the sno to Three Feathers SCREAMING... we spin again... crash thr bushes, then suddenly TUMBLE... DROP THROUGH THE SNOW. 67.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...seeing Spotted Horse pick up his pace... start trottin forward. Glass does the same... all the hunters convergin around a LARGE BLACK HOLE IN THE SNOW...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and the ELK trapped at the bottom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The warriors cry out victoriously... begin DRIVING THEIR SPEARS INTO THE TRAP, killing the animal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The elk roasts over a fire at the center of the village. Glass sits alone outside the tee-pee, using the sharp tip the spear to carve into a small chunk of wood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he carves, New Moon and Little One sneak around the te pee behind him... watch Glass work. Glass hears them GIGGLING... doesn't react... just keeps carving... tilts long handle of the spear as he works, tapping the side of tee-pee, and SHAKING LOOSE A CLUMP OF SNOW DOWN ONTO THE BOYS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The shocked boys freeze in the cold... wipe the snow from their faces to see Glass grinning at them. The little boy charge Glass, leaping onto him... wrestling him to the ground, as they squeeze his hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tatanka Wicasa! Tatanka Wicasa!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spotted Horse stands across the village, watching Glass a the boys play in the snow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass stands at the edge of the village, carving at the w with the spear tip, and watching the Sioux from a distanc Yellow Bear sees him... approaches, carrying his SON on h shoulders. The little boy gnaws on a strip of meat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spotted Horse holds out a bowl of food to Glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good hunt. 68.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass smiles up at Spotted Horse's son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You. Fam-i-lee?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shakes his head) No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No wom-an? (pointing to son) Wakayaja?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long beat, then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Not for a long time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass continues eating... watches Spotted Horse bounce th giggling little boy on his shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass steps out of his tee-pee, whittling with the spear He glances up... freezes because he sees several Sioux pulling the hides from the line... rolling them up to car

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spotted Horse (O.S.) Bra-zo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass turns to Spotted Horse, pointing to the hides. Glas nods... looks back to the last of the hides being pulled down... doesn't seem as excited as he once might have bee

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spotted Horse and Three Feathers sit atop their horses. Three Feathers holds the reins to another horse packed wi hides. An empty horse stands beside them... waiting for Glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass is leaning over to New Moon and Little One... handi them the CRUDE BUFFALO CARVING he made from the wood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (taps his chest) Tatanka Wicasa. 69.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The little boys smile. Glass nods to Waki, then waves to Hawk and the Medicine Man. They return it... watch Glass climb onto his horse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass, Spotted Horse and Three Feathers ride out of the village.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass, Spotted Horse and Three Feathers ride along a high ridge, surrounded by empty snow-covered wilderness. They have the world to themselves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass crouches over a shallow, five-foot long hole surrou by deep snow. The hole is filled with small fires and roc And he's watching Spotted Horse and Three Feathers tossin rocks into their own matching holes, then dragging the di back into them. Spotted Horse throws a glance back to Gla making sure he understands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass nods... pulls the dirt back in, covering the flames He watches Spotted Horse spread a blanket over the warm ground, then does the same. He sits on the mound of dirt. leans back against a tree... feels the warmth rise up fro beneath him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He nods to Spotted Horse, who is already resting under hi blanket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass pulls the buffalo hide around himself... keeping wa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SPOTTED HORSE (cont'd) Sleep. No Arikara.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass nods... but still doesn't close his eyes. Spotted Horse tosses his knife over beside Glass. Glass takes it. nods to Spotted Horse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SPOTTED HORSE (cont'd) Me sleep. 70.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spotted Horse rolls over, turning his back on Glass... trusting him with the knife. Three Feathers does the same

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass just stares out into the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dark and quiet... except for the SNORING of a few men. Fitzgerald sleeps on his cot. A shadow glides across him. hovers over his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fitzgerald's eyes blink open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...on GLASS STANDING OVER HIM... his scarred face calm an deadly... raising a knife to drive down into Fitzgerald's chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Glass swings the blade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Spotted Horse shaking Glass awake from his dream. Gla hand flies up, the knife gripped. But Spotted Horse grabs his arm... stops it in mid-swing... holds it until Glass realizes it was a dream... relaxes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass calms... nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a small cluster of log buildings sitting along the b of the Missouri. Dozens of tee-pees and tents are set up outside the complex.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass follows Spotted Horse and Three Feathers into the c BEGGING INDIANS and DRUNK TRAPPERS paw at the men as they ride past, pleading for handouts. 71.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of the Indians grabs for the hides. Three Feathers plants his foot in the Indian's chest... shoves him back the snow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They continue on... climb off their horses outside the TRADING POST. Three Feathers stays to guard the hides, as Spotted Horse and Glass enter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small, dingy room lined with shelves, all stacked high pots, pans, dry goods, whiskey, blankets, weapons... anyt that can be traded. KIOWA BRAZEAU, (60's), French-Canadia stands behind the counter... looks up when the BELL over door RINGS... sees Spotted Horse with Glass behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thick French accent) Bon jour, Spotted Horse. You come with many hides I hope. (off Spotted Horse's nod) We make good trades then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brazeau's eyes lock on Glass... stares at him, unsure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monsieur Glass?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good to see you again, Mr. Brazeau.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ, what happened to your goddamned face?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Had a tussle with a grizzly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass shakes Brazeau's hand. Brazeau studies his face... notices the Bear Claw Necklace... smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now the grizzly, he don't look so good either, eh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (off Spotted Horse) You run with the Sioux these days? 72.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They looked after me for a spell. I'm on my way to catch back up with Captain Henry... at Fort Union. Needed to trade for some supplies on the Company's credit if I could.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oui, of course. Anything you like.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass pulls down a KENTUCKY LONG RIFLE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can start with this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass is loaded with gear. He signs a ticket for Brazeau.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can pick up the horse at the livery in the morning. (off Glass' nod) I wish I could give you a room for the night, but...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brazeau looks to SEVERAL TRAPPERS standing across the roo glaring at Glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I cannot risk the trouble of letting a colored stay inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass glances to the trappers... one of them spits in Gla direction... makes some MONKEY SOUNDS... daring Glass to respond. Glass just turns away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Won't be the last night I sleep on the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass nods to Brazeau, then walks out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take care of that face, Glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spotted Horse and Three Feathers sit on their horses. The other horses are now packed with new goods. Glass approaches. 73.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (points to the tents) You stay here tonight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spotted Horse shakes his head... motions back toward the wilderness. Then he points to the trading post... the TRAPPERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your people?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass looks back to all the white faces... trappers, drun prostitutes. He shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You come then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spotted Horse taps his own chest... points back the way t came. Glass hesitates, almost like he's considering it... then he shakes his head again... points the opposite way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fort Union.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spotted Horse stares at Glass a long beat, then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You spend your life hunting enemy. Enemy wins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It will be over soon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then Glass pulls the Bear Claw Necklace off... hands it t Spotted Horse. Spotted Horse holds it... then proudly sli it over his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spotted Horse raises his hand in goodbye, then spins his horse and starts away. Three Feathers does the same. Glas returns it... watches them ride off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass is in the trees beyond the tents and tee-pees... crouched on the ground... 74. dragging the dirt back over the fire and rocks. He slides onto the mound... feels the warmth, and smiles... just a little.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass rides a PAINT MARE along a ridge overlooking the ri Fort Brazeau stands in the distance behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snowy and cold. Glass leads the line of riders through th snow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you can't tell if it's day or night through the blizz Fitzgerald, Pig, Anderson, Bridger, Murphy and Stubby Joe trudge through the snow in their snowshoes... finally rea the bunkhouse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anderson shoves the door closed against the wind... latch it. The men look worn and battered... wind-burnt faces, icicles in their beards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had enough of this cold as hell shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'd you figure when ya signed on outta that St. Louis whorehouse you was workin'? That you was headin' off to paradise?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pig snorts a laugh at Fitzgerald's expense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I tell ya what I figured, I figured I'd be somewhere the piss wouldn't freeze before I got it outta my pecker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Figured wrong. 75.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fitzgerald throws Bridger a glare... wants to throw more, Bridger's returning the stare... hard... so Fitzgerald decides he'd better not push it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Waste a time to check traps in this weather... while Henry sits warmin' his ass on the stove in his office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you go tell him that, Fitz? Then start your hike back to St. Louie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit, I walked up here, I got no problem walkin' back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Contracted for twelve months. We all did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry can shove that contract up his toasty warm ass, or I'll do it for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The others laugh at Fitzgerald's rambling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't think I will?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men shake their heads. Fitzgerald grabs his gloves... starts strapping his snowshoes back on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just give that fat little whore you're so sweet on a couple extra bits... she'll have you thinkin' it's Spring already.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men laugh as Fitzgerald walks out... leaves the door open for the cold wind to pour over the others. Pig scurr over, shoving it closed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the other men gather around a table to play cards, Bri pulls a JOURNAL from under his cot... falls onto the cot, starts writing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fitzgerald enters... looks around the empty office. 76.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello? Captain?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The place is empty. Fitzgerald eyes Henry's desk... then past his desk... to the SAFE... its door CRACKED OPEN... STACKS OF MONEY visible inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fitzgerald glances around... looks back to that safe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dark and quiet. The snow has stopped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fitzgerald eases up from his cot... looks around at the sleeping men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fitzgerald slips out of the bunkhouse door... across the compound... toward the front gate.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Where're you headed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fitzgerald looks up... sees Murphy in the Blockhouse on sentry duty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To the river, Murphy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy squints down into the shadows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That you, Fitzgerald?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Left my rifle down there... don't want it out all night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That weren't too smart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just don't take a shot at me when I come back in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll see. 77.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy waves Fitzgerald out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not that you'd hit me if you tried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy fakes a laugh... raises his rifle down at Fitzgera

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...on Fitzgerald moving toward the river... disappearing the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out of sight from the fort. Fitzgerald slides the ANSTADT FROM UNDER HIS COAT... hurries down the bank... searches under the brush and snow... pulls out an OVERTURNED CANOE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He drags it to the icy edge... slides it across the ice toward the middle of the river, where the water still has frozen over. The ice CRACKS UNDER HIS FEET. Fitzgerald climbs in the canoe... pounds the ice with the oar, break it loose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The current seeps through the cracks... catches the canoe pulling it to the center of the wide river... sends Fitzgerald shooting south. He throws a glance back at the shadow of Fort Union in the distance... growing smaller.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clear blue sky. The sun glistening off the snow-covered ground. Glass is bundled under furs, as he rides through snowy trees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tucked under the rooftop of trees. A small fire burns. Glass sits on his fire-bed, looking over a map.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An O.S. SNORT from the Paint Mare, tied to a tree. Glass looks over in time to see the horse's ears perk up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With his eyes searching the darkness, Glass slowly reache over... grabs his rifle. Then he drops to his stomach... slides backward into the brush. 78.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass peers through the brush... the woods seem empty... until SEVERAL DARK SHAPES APPEAR... moving through the distant trees... coming straight toward Glass' camp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then an O.S. SNAP BEHIND GLASS... he glances back in time see an ARIKARA WARRIOR SWINGING A HATCHET.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass spins his rifle... shoves it into the stomach of th Warrior as he swings... BOOM... the Warrior flies back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dark woods suddenly ERUPT IN WAR CRIES... Arikara app from all sides... charge toward the camp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass scrambles up... races toward the Paint Mare as ARRO AND GUNSHOTS FLASH THROUGH THE AIR ALL AROUND HIM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass swings up onto the Paint Mare... spots ELK'S TONGUE leading the charge... the necklace of ears hanging around neck. And Elk's Tongue's eyes are locked on Glass... almo like he remembers him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass takes off through the forest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass hanging onto the paint mare, as she gallops through trees... the animal's nostrils spread wide, pulling in al the oxygen it can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass glances back... sees SHAPES BEHIND HIM... HORSES... ridden by Elk's Tongue and eight other warriors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass digs his heels into the horse, squeezing every ounc speed from her legs... pushing her toward the clearing up ahead... throwing another glance back... then looking in front of him, and realizing it isn't a clearing at all...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...it's the edge of the world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The paint mare explodes from the trees, then runs out of ground... because she's just galloped off the side of a cliff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The horse sails downward toward a thick forest of trees, legs flailing for something to stand on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass drops the rifle to grip the horse's mane, hanging o for what seems an endless fall. 79.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The mare SLAMS LEG-FIRST INTO THE TREE-TOPS with Glass st on her back. The Paint Mare SQUEALS as she drops into the snow-covered trees, carrying Glass with her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the horse comes crashing through the branches... the massive limbs slowing her fall... snapping off as her bod hits and twists... tosses Glass away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Paint Mare continues her deadly descent, the trees tearing at her body... catching her head... SNAPPING her neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass slams off a branch... tumbles to the ground with a thud. The Paint Mare hits the snow beside him... very dea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass struggles to breath... finally GASPS... sucks in th oxygen. He lays there a moment... stares up through the trees...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...to Elk's Tongue and the others staring down from the t of the cliff... with no way to get to Glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass rises to his knees... glances around for his rifle. lost. He flinches with what must be broken ribs... drags himself up, and staggers to the horse... pulls his knife cuts the snowshoes from the back of the saddle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He throws the snowshoes over his shoulder... continues on through the woods... alone... in the middle of nowhere... again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From high above... the small shape of Glass making his wa over the snowy ground... heading toward TWO DISTANT SHACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A makeshift town on the banks of the Missouri. Two ramshackle structures... the General Store and a tattered livery stable filled with horses. 80.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More like a saloon that sells a few supplies. A gang of TRAPPERS drink and play cards. A RUNTY MAN stands behind counter, watching them...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...until the door blows open, and in steps Glass. He pull the fur hat away from his face, and what a sight he is... scarred face stiff from the cold... ice frozen in his bea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room falls silent... everyone staring at Glass. Until TRAPPER #1 snorts a laugh. Glass limps to the counter. Al eyes follow him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (struggling to make his frozen lips move) I'm Hugh Glass of...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't serve niggers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass stares at the Runty Man a beat, then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of the Rocky Mountain Fur Company on my way to Fort Union.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't care if you was with Lewis and Clark headed for the new world. We don't serve niggers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All I need is a horse and enough supplies to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ice musta froze up his ears, `cause he ain't listenin' to you, Cees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...to get me to Fort Union. I can sign a draft made good by Captain Henry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Runty Man just stares at Glass... grins a TOOTHLESS G

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck happened to your face, boy? You try to slice all the black off? 81.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe we oughta help him do it right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Best get on your way, boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass stares back at the men for a long beat, then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Hugh Glass of the Rocky Mountain Fur Company, and all I need is...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the trappers) Do you believe this shit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trapper #1 and Trapper #2 pull the SKINNING KNIVES from t belts... start toward Glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell, I warned ya.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All I need...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that's when Trapper #1 grabs for Glass, but in a flas movement that catches them all off-guard, Glass has is ow knife pulled and JAMMED UNDER TRAPPER #1's CHIN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone freezes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...is a horse and enough supplies to get me to Fort Union.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then Glass slides Trapper #1's PISTOL from his belt... ai it at the other men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And this shooter here. All made good by Captain Henry and The Rocky Mountain Fur Company.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The snow pours down on the Runty Man and the trappers, as they stand outside, rifles aimed into the distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shoot him, goddammit! 82.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't get a clear look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shoot `em both!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Runty Man snatches one of the rifles... BOOM... fires wild shot past the riders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...with Trapper #1 sitting backward on the horse behind h Glass has the pistol jammed into his ribs, and keeps glan back to the men growing smaller behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally, Glass shoves the man off the back of the horse. Trapper #1 tumbles into the snow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The RUMBLE OF DISTANT GUNSHOTS... too far away to reach Glass, who just keeps racing north.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get after the son of a bitch!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The trappers exchange glances... don't move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's cold as hell, Cees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he did say to put it all on the Rocky Mountain tab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Runty Man glares at the trappers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass riding the horse at a trot through the snow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thick with fog, and silent as death. The moon fights its through the mist, sending an eerie glow over the fort. 83.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stubby Bill sits dozing in a chair, his rifle across his O.S. CRUNCHING... getting louder... loud enough to nudge Stubby Bill awake. He sits up... peers over the wall, but can't see anything in the fog... just hears the CRUNCHING MOVING CLOSER... FOOTSTEPS IN THE CRISP SNOW.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...on the blanket of fog hanging in the air... that same CRUNCHING, as a SHADOW APPEARS... growing clearer... a FI walking... leading a horse behind him... appearing out of mist like a ghost... GLASS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...sure his eyes are betraying him. But then Glass looks straight up at Stubby Bill, and there's no doubt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dark and quiet... just Pig's snoring rattling the silence Suddenly the door kicks open... SLAMS into the wall... an there's GLASS' SILHOUETTE FILLING THE DOORWAY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GROANS from the awakened men... hands moving through the for oil lamps... turning them bright... until the room's fully lit... and they all see Glass standing there... eye floating across the room, searching for a target.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men just stare back at him, like they're all part of same dream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Except for Bridger, who's propped up in his cot like he's been waiting all night... waiting every night... for Glas appear in that doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass raises the stolen pistol... aims it at Bridger. And the young man doesn't flinch... almost as if he wants to sure Glass doesn't miss. 84.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The other men just watch in silence, not sure what the he going on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass holds his aim on Bridger's face... a face that's haunted him... kept him alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You took everything I had... left me to die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass walks toward Bridger, the gun still raised... each of his feet on the wood floor is like the thud of an executioner's drum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MUMBLING from the other men, as they watch this ghost rea Bridger... stand over him, the pistol aimed down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was scared of dyin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But every day since, I've wished I had.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass' finger tightens on the trigger, ready to make Bridger's wish come true.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rest of the bunkhouse watches this execution in wide- eyed, stone silence, afraid to move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There wasn't no `Ree that night, was there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long beat, then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass PISTOL WHIPS BRIDGER, knocking him to the floor. An before Bridger can crawl away, Glass in over him... those aching, frozen fists beating mercilessly down on Bridger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Bridger doesn't fight back... just does his best to c up, but the blows keep coming, and Bridger's face is cove in blood...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...just as Henry runs inside, half-dressed from where Stu Bill awoke him. Henry grabs Glass... pulls him off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass spins... jams his pistol right in Henry's face. 85.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hugh. Wait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass is crazy with rage... barely stops himself from pul that trigger. But finally, he calms... his arm sinks, lowering his aim. He glances around the bunkhouse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Fitzgerald and my rifle?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deserted two days ago. Along with about five hundred dollars of company money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's get some coffee to warm you up. (to Glass, but looking at

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanna hear what happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass looks back to Bridger... they hold a long stare, un Glass walks out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait. Please!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Glass and Henry disappear, leaving Bridger alone with those eyes burning into him. Bridger looks to Pig, but Pi just lowers his eyes... can't even look at the boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men step into their boots and furs... file out after Glass and Henry... leaving Bridger alone in the bunkhouse

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass sits by the warmth of the stove, sipping coffee. Henry's behind he desk, with the other men scattered arou

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I cut the shoes loose of her, and hiked over to Fort Talbot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christ almighty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you may hear from the fella there about a stoled horse and supplies charged to you. 86.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll take care of it. You should go settle in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a couple fair whores next door that'll ease the miles on ya, scars or not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stubby Bill gives Murphy an elbow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, Murph.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just meant I'd go roust one of `em for ya if you wanted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She can take the night off, but I wouldn't mind the use of her bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go clear out a room. The rest head on back to bunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy hustles out. The others move toward the door, each stopping to shake Glass' hand, or give him a pat on the b

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told ya I'd see ya up here. You remember that, Hugh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do, Pig. You must have a little gypsy in ya.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pig grins and nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll see ya in the mornin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pig exits, leaving just Glass and Henry, sitting in a bea silence, until...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I talk you outta what you're planning?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass doesn't answer... just stands, placing the coffee c on the table. 87.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you for what you done for me... stitchin' me back together... givin' me a chance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm offerin' you another right now... to stay here... let this thing go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He thinks he let me die. But he don't know that he's the one that's kept me alive... for the chance of findin' him... makin' him pay for what he done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The law will make Fitzgerald pay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass stares out the window... his SCARRED REFLECTION sta back at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You told me once that other men didn't think like him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the truth is, most do. I seen it my whole life... the looks folks give... the whisperin'. I watched my wife and son die from the fever on accounta no white doctor would care for `em. Wasn't no different to them than if their neighbor's dog was sick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I don't figure nobody's gonna care much that Fitzgerald took some dyin' nigger's rifle, and left him in the middle of nowhere. (turns to Henry) Do you, Captain?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry doesn't answer... because he knows Glass is right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thank you for the coffee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass walks out. Henry just sits there. 88.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass, Pig and Murphy stand by Glass' horse, as he ties o his supplies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He said he was goin' to get his rifle...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then Murphy catches himself... shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your rifle. But he never showed back up. The next day I figured him mighta fell in, but then Pig seen the canoe was missin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the Captain found the money gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll make my way down river. See what turns up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass pulls the cinch tight around the horse. Stubby Bill comes waddling toward them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kid's gone... gear and all. Musta slipped out before light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stubby Bill waves Bridger's journal at them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STUBBY BILL (cont'd) Just left this on his bunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry takes the journal... flips it open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Every day I think about what I done. I want to tell Pig and the others the truth but am afraid what they'll think of me. I look at Fitzgerald and want to kill him but am afraid to try. I am a coward and wish he hadn't been lyin about the Ree that night. I wish they had come and kilt us both."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass considers the words a beat, then swings onto his ho 89.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I run across the boy, I'll send him back your way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass sees Henry on horseback, trotting toward them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where're you headed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fitzgerald stole five hundred dollars. Rocky Mountain Fur Company wants him too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can do this on my own.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you can. But maybe you won't have to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass stares at Henry a beat, then finally just pulls his horse around... heads for the river. Henry nods to Pig an Murphy as he follows after Glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From above Fort Union. Our POV on Glass and Henry riding south along the icy river.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then we see our POV is Bridger's... standing along th ledge, loaded with all his gear. He watches the riders another moment, then turns... hikes the opposite directio leaving Fort Union behind forever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Runty Man behind the counter. A few of the same Trapp drinking... playing cards. Just another day at Fort Talbo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door swings open, and a FUR-COVERED FIGURE enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We ain't got no food to spare, friend, if that's what you're lookin' for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The figure pulls back his furs, and we see it's Fitzgeral cold and miserable. 90.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then what the hell have ya got?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whiskey and blankets mostly. Weather's held back deliveries.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fitzgerald throws a glance to the Trappers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gimme a couple bottles then. Goddamn ice shredded my boat. Been walkin' for two days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Runty Man hands Fitzgerald the bottles. Fitzgerald po one... gulps some down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much for one of them horses out there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Horses ain't cheap this time a year.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever the price, Rocky Mountain Fur Company's good for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And those words stop everything. The Trappers all turn fr their game. The Runty Man glares at Fitzgerald.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're the second son of a bitch come in here makin' that claim. And the first one left a bad taste.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That right? Well I don't know nothin' about that. Just that I need a horse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So did this other fella. So he stole one... along with Lange's pistola.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trapper #1 nods to Fitzgerald.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine then, I'll pay cash for the horse. How much? 91.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How `bout you pay for your friend's too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And my shooter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wasn't my friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trapper #1 stands up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then from where I stand, you don't got no friends at all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The other Trappers glare at Fitzgerald. The Runty Man jus grins that toothless smile of his. Fitzgerald's in a bind and he knows it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, okay. I'll collect from him. How much?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How `bout we say eighty... (sees Fitzgerald doesn't

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...five.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fitzgerald starts digging into his pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You boys are leavin' me with nothin'. Better be a helluva horse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pick of the litter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Runty Man snatches the cash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RUNTY MAN (cont'd) And when you see that scarred-up nigger, you tell him he'd best not show up here again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fitzgerald freezes... not sure he heard correctly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I see who? 92.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The black son of a bitch that robbed me. You tell him that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long beat, then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scarred up, you say... and headed up to Union?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what he told us. Seemed real anxious to get there too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
