dialogues.text: I'll make sure to give him the message when I find him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fitzgerald sits on the horse, staring back over the groun his LINE OF TRACKS LEADING THROUGH THE SNOW. He turns... looks south, then back to the tracks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally, Fitzgerald digs his heels into the horse. The animal takes off, right along Fitzgerald's tracks in the snow... right back toward Glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thick ice along the edges, tapering to a narrow stream of flowing water at the very center.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass and Henry ride along the snow-covered bank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry points. Glass follows his finger along the river... a CANOE resting on the bank ahead. They dismount... exami the canoe... the letters "RMFC" painted on the side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass runs his mittened hand along the gashes in the wood

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ice tore it up. 93.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass looks to the FOOTPRINTS IN THE SNOW, leading deep i the trees. He glances up to the sky... clear and blue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If the snow holds off, we'll have a good trail to track.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's out that direction? Talbot?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the Missouri. Doubt he'd risk the river with the `Ree. Likely grab a horse, and cross over high... take his chances goin' east against the weather. When'd you say he skipped out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three days ago now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We best pick up our pace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They climb back onto their horses... trot into the trees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass and Henry gallop across, their path dead on Fitzgerald's tracks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The snow is shallow here, the ground protected by the tre There's a black spot where a fire once burned, and footpr all over the place. Glass is off his horse, crouched, studying the site... lifting the charred chunks of wood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This was Fitzgerald camped here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Couple nights back. But these tracks aren't all his.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's travelin' with somebody? 94.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shakes his head) Came in after. Prints are smooth. Mocassins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry throws Glass a look... he knows what that means.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could be Sioux... Blackfoot even.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you figure they're `Ree.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't figure nothin', Captain. But whoever it is, they're a good day behind Fitzgerald.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass walks, leading his horse, as he follows the tracks from camp. Henry rides after him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And they're on his trail too, so we should keep it quiet... don't announce we're back here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You told me once you knew enough to keep away from the `Ree.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You figure this is smart then?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass swings up onto his horse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're welcome to head back, Captain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass trots off. Henry watches him a beat, then throws a glance into the trees... follows after Glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass kneels on the ground, building a fire-bed... draggi the dirt over the fire and rocks. Henry's under a blanket watching him. 95.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if we find Fitzgerald... and I ask you not to do this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass spreads a blanket over the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't ask me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass settles in on the warm earth. Henry just keeps watching him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...asleep under the blanket. O.S. RUSTLING sends his eyes flashing open. He raises up... rifle ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He glances at Glass, who puts a finger over his lips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: `Ree?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass doesn't answer... just keeps searching the brush.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry's groggy eyes dart around the night... spots MOVEME IN THE BRUSH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it's too late... Henry fires... BOOM... the shot expl through the night...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and the DEER leaps away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry looks to Glass... shakes his head... sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So much for stayin' quiet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...staring out into the darkness, as the GUNSHOT ECHOES O HIM. Fitzgerald immediately throws dirt over the flames.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass and Henry are loaded up, back on their horses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guess you would've been better off on your own.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We needed to pick up some time anyways.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two riders disappear into the dark trees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass and Henry riding across a meadow. Glass stops... ti his head back to sniff the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatta ya got?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smoke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass pulls some snow from his horse's mane... tosses it the air, and watches it blow to the side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass turns his horse toward the breeze... squints out in the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No more than mile out that way. (pulls his rifle) I'll head in from the west... you take the east.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if it's `Ree?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then we leave `em be... meet back up here. 97.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry nods... Glass takes off at a trot. Henry veers the other direction... splitting up across the snow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Splinters of moonlight shoot through the pines. Glass on horseback, walking through the trees... appearing and disappearing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He spots something in the distance... the slightest of gl Glass eases off his horse... wraps the reins around a bra

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry's already off his horse... leading it through the trees... searching as he walks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass moves silently through the darkness... rifle poised aim and fire... just like the first time we saw him, perfectly comfortable in this world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His eyes shine in the darkness, drifting back and forth.. picking up everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He reaches the glow... the remains of a campfire. The slightest bit of dying smoke rises into the air. Glass crouches down, studying the surround ground... HOOF-PRINT blended in with the other tracks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry's horse is making too much noise with each step. He stops walking... wraps the reins around a tree... walks b around the horse...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Glass' Anstadt aimed and ready to fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't figure an important man like you to be away from your stove on a night as cold as this, Captain. You lost?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry just stares back at Fitzgerald and that rifle. His eyes drift to his own rifle, still strapped onto his sadd 98.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm here to save your life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I done told you boys... I don't need savin' by you or nobody else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry knows he's only got one chance... he makes a grab f the rifle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass running his fingers across the tracks. Suddenly an O.S. GUNSHOT EXPLODES IN THE DISTANCE. Glass spins to it. races back through the trees toward his horse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass at full gallop through the woods... veering between trees... ducking branches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass charges from the forest... spots Henry's horse stan in the trees... tears through the snow toward it... leaps the still-moving animal in a fluid slide... hits the grou with his rifle ready...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and sees HENRY'S BODY face-up in the snow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass drops to a knee... scans the darkness, as he slides over to Henry...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and we see he's a bloody mess... a GUNSHOT WOUND in hi chest leaking out onto the snow... HIS HEAD SCALPED... LE EAR SLICED OFF.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass stands back up, turning in a circle, as he peers in the distance around him. But there's nothing out there. Glass SCREAMS in rage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns back to Henry... crouches down over him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You shouldn't a come.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Glass looks at Henry, he notices something... takes He by the chin, and tilts his head. And HENRY'S RIGHT EAR HA BEEN CUT OFF AS WELL. 99.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass stares at Henry a beat, then squints out into the forest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (repeating Spotted Horse's words under his breath) Arikara take right ear of Sioux. Left ear of whites. Not know what they take from you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass on horseback, leading Henry's horse behind him acro the snow-covered meadow. Henry's fur-covered body is drap over the saddle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A thick layer of ice covers the narrow river, thinning ju bit at the center. Glass kneels near the middle, chopping the thick ice to get to the water beneath. He makes a hole... dips his canteen down into it, glancing around in the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then Glass turns... stares up a slope into the dark fores beyond... like he knows what's waiting for him there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks to the horses, tied in the trees at the base of slope... Henry still laying across the saddle of his hors his bloody furs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass SNAPS A BRANCH FROM A FALLEN TREE... looks back up slope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...watching from the shadowy brush, as Glass appears up o the distant slope... riding through the trees, with Henry draped over the horse behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The forest is quiet... just the CRACKING of crusty snow a branches under the horses' hooves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then BOOM... as the ANSTADT BARREL WE HADN'T SEEN BESIDE FLASHES IN THE NIGHT...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and Glass tumbles off his horse. 100.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The horses prance around with a start, then settle... and then FITZGERALD RISES FROM THE BRUSH BESIDE US... eases toward the horses, reloading the Anstadt as he moves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He reaches Glass, face down in the snow... his furs cover him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Fitzgerald has that rifle aimed, ready for Glass to suddenly roll over firing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...but Glass doesn't move. Fitzgerald nudges him with his boot, then crouches down... grabs Glass by the shoulder, pulls him over...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and there's HENRY'S LIFELESS FACE HIDDEN BENEATH THE FURS... and that BROKEN BRANCH sticking up along his back

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...on the REST OF THE BRANCH RIGGED TO GLASS' SADDLE to h Henry upright...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and then what we thought was Henry flung over the seco horse... MOVING... the bloody fur-covered arm lifting a rifle... the head raising up... it's GLASS... taking aim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...as Fitzgerald realizes what's happened... spins with t Anstadt...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...to Glass laying across the horse... rifle dead set on Fitzgerald... BOOM... BOOM... both rifles explode...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Fitzgerald goes flying backward into the brush.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fitzgerald's wild shot hits Henry's horse, sending it rea up, tossing Glass to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Glass is on his feet in a flash... reloading as he charges into the brush...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...but FITZGERALD IS GONE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Until the flash of movement behind Glass... he turns... a the butt of the Anstadt whips through the air... WHACK... clubs him across the head, sending him tumbling down the slope to the frozen river.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fitzgerald swings the Anstadt back over his BLOODY SHOULD snatches up his knife, and charges down the slope to fini Glass off. 101.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass lies on the ice, barely conscious. Blood oozes down his head... over his eyes. He wipes it away to see Fitzgerald barreling down toward him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fitzgerald dives in attack, but Glass kicks up his leg, sending Fitzgerald flying over... SLAMMING into the froze river, his head CRACKING THE ICE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass rips the knife from his belt... moves after Fitzger his feet slipping and sliding under him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fitzgerald rises to his feet... the men charge like two w animals... crash into each other... knives flailing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They roll along the ice, blades glistening... slicing thr furs... across flesh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fitzgerald thrusts his knife down... plants it through th back of Glass' hand, pinning it to the ice. Glass CRIES OUT... drops his own knife to pull Fitzgerald's out. As h does, Fitzgerald kicks Glass in the face, sending him sai back... sliding to the center of the river.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The thin ice around him splinters... cracks. Glass looks up... sees Fitzgerald stalking toward him, HOLDING BOTH KNIVES now. Glass is trapped...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...until he pounds his elbow down on the weakened ice... begins to give... he pounds it again and again... Fitzger speeds up to get to Glass in time... raises one of the knives, as Glass shatters the ice... drops beneath the surface.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fitzgerald rushes after him, but the ice cracks under his feet, forcing him back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and Glass just under the ice, floating with the curren His fingers search for a hole, but there's nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...making his way down the river, peering through the ice searching for Glass. He spots something... stops... leans close to make out the shape... it's GLASS' FEET.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then suddenly, GLASS' FIST EXPLODES THROUGH THE ICE AT FITZGERALD'S FEET... grab Fitzgerald's leg, pulling him d

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fitzgerald crashes to the ice... it splinters around him. gives away, and he sinks into the icy water... but the ANSTADT STRAPPED AROUND HIM CATCHES ON THE ICE... holds h against the current.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass drags himself from the water... stands... stares do at Fitzgerald trapped in the hole... his face looking up Glass through the ice. Glass lifts one of the fallen knives... stands over Fitzgerald.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (through the water and

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help me! (off Glass' stare) Glass... please!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass hesitates a beat, staring at him, just as he did wi Bridger that night in the bunkhouse. And then Glass leans down... grabs the Anstadt to pull Fitzgerald up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Except Glass SLICES THE BLADE ACROSS THE STRAP OF THE ANSTADT, sending Fitzgerald floating away under the ice, Glass holds on to the Anstadt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...floating under the surface... pounding at the ice as h drifts, until his swinging slows... stops... his body dri away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass stands on the ice, blood dripping down his face, holding his Anstadt. He begins to tremble... not from the cold, but from finally reaching the end of this journey. eyes begin to fill with tears... 103.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and then he sees ELK'S TONGUE, and SEVERAL OTHER ARIKA WARRIORS watching him from the other side of the river.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass and Elk's Tongue exchange a long stare, until final Glass SCREAMS OUT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am Tatanka Wicasa! I have killed whites and I have killed Arikara and I have killed grizzly! AND I

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elk's Tongue doesn't move... just stares back at Glass... soaked in blood and water. Then Glass CRIES OUT at the warriors again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the Arikara don't attack... don't move at all... unti Elk's Tongue gives Glass the SLIGHTEST OF NODS, then turn they disappear back into the trees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass watches them fade away, then collapses to his knees the icy river... exhausted in every possible way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He begins to cry.
